IssuerName: Premera Blue Cross Blue Shield of Alaska
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue cross blue sheld more then doubled their rates, and offer the worst insurance coverage ever, their deductables are high, out of pocket high, why have insurance when you pay for everything yourself. their $600.00 a month policy is now $1,700.00 a month. sham sham', 'Isitusal, i took the best policy offered by my employer because i am a cancer survivor and testing is expensive. i also am being treated for depression and the meds i am prescribed are very expensive. however, the cost of just under $105.00 per week is to hard to keep up with along with my co-pays.', 'Ive learned i should pay a little more out of poc, im still seeking insurance that fits my budget.this company has good coverage but am paying a higher premium than i need because i dont have serious health conditions.', 'I always thought this was the best, but the monthly premiums are expensive and now that i am on senior care it seems to cover less than it once did.', 'Decent coverage but controlling, they switched my medication without going through my doctor due to it being cheaper for them. the new medication is not as effective and they declined my switch back to the old medication. currently appealing it.', 'Service sucks!!, i have been having some troubles with ordering prescriptions. the pharmacist wants to charge me 400 bucks after my deductible has been made. i have contacted bcbs several times and nothing has been done. they told me they would have it fixed yesterday, but no one called back. i left 3 messages yesterday with the case manager. can you help? any suggestions? case manager: bonita valles 401-459-5534 case number 4769-20mar17 so, as you can see, the case started on march 20th, but i actually called them a few days before that and they gave me an incomplete case number. i have psoriasis and it gets worse when i cant get my meds and if i get frustrated! well, i am frustrated. i am at the point where i need to get lawyers involved or go to channel 12 or 10.', 'Very costly', 'I detest this co but it is better than my last, clear your entire day if you need to get info from empire bc bs. it is very expensive insurance, you do not get to see the doctors you would like to see (hmo) and dealing with customer service is frustrating at best. you remain on hold forever and are transferred to three different people who put you on hold forever and it leaves such a bad taste in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 why did i have to pay one for 2016. the customer service representative had told me that it was a mistake on their part to charge me early. and that next month in jan i would only need to pay my 2016 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no emails/mail! now, just got off the phone with another representative, a male this time. i saw that my payments this month were still for the new 2017, so i called to see why. the representative this time was unhelpful, he was confused most of the time, kept repeating the same information to me even after i told him several times that what he was telling me had nothing to do with my questions. it was stressful. the guy told me in the most round-about-way why i must pay my 2017 premium this month, and repeatedly kept avoiding my concerns. according to the new representative, the other representative i talked to (the lady) was wrong! you pay a month in advance. i am new to insurances, so this may be the correct, maybe this guy lied, i dont know. but someone lied to me. and i wanted someone to look into my conversation with the lady. i asked him if blue shield records conversations, he said yes after several attempts to avoid this question. but here is the best part, my previous conversation with the lady was not recorded. how convenient. he said he looked it up and doesn’t see a recording. she didn’t log in her location at the time. they cant trace the call without that or without a confirmation number which she never gave me. this played out too conveniently and is disgusting how they dealt with it. its about more than saving a few dollars now. at this point this is all about whats right and this is not', 'Wish there was a zero star, my brother was in a horrible car accident had 7 surgeries and now he is in rehab hospital dr recommended at least a month in rehab, after 5 days of rehab blue cross said he is ok to go home after there retarded dr mckinsey read his medical records , stupid dr it is obvious you never went to med school my brother can not walk or turn on his own he has tubes hanging out of his stomach, he can barely move 7 surgeries stupid dr mckinsey a 5 year old could have looked at his medical records and understand that he is not walikng or moving,i will make sure every news station gets ahold of this, you sure are good collecting your payments', 'Insurance through employment benefits, had bcbs for past 35 years. now that retired and but they use to take my excellent health status into consideration. now they do not and my monthly bill will be going up 178%. i cant afford to stay on this plan with that amount per month. i have only been to the hospital once in my life and that was for a ruptured appendix and take one generic medication. otherwise, i am very healthy,and i hate to say this, for my age. they have been very good whenever i have had a question or concern, but the cost is too much as i am unemployed at the moment. i have been going to a gym for 34 years and eat right. i rarely see the doctor and i only see one these days for preventative medicine procedures. i find it sad that i have done everything right in my life and now i have to pay more for it. i probably will not be staying with bcbs because of the cost.', 'Need health coverage, turning age 26 years of age on december 11. 2013 and will no longer have coverage under my mothers health insurance policy. i need some kind of coverage before i am aged out of her health policy with her employer.', 'Lack of support, i have a visa interview at the french embassy on 18th of may. today is 11th of may. the embassy requires a letter from the insurance company confirming that my policy covers emergencies while in france. i called the customer service. the guy confirmed that the letter will be sent to me by mail and will take at least 7 to 10 business days!!! - i asked if theres any way i can get it before 18th (the interview date)? * no. sorry. - can i pay the cost of faster mailing system that can guarantee the letter delivering before the 18th? * no. sorry. - can the letter be sent to me by email? since you say it is now ready? * no. sorry. - can anyone take a picture or scan and text that letter to me for my urgent need to it? * no. sorry. - well. my entire travel plan is dependent on the visa, and the visa is dependent on a letter from you. my travel plan might be messed up due to your slow ten business days mailing system, and you still insist not to send this letter via email??!! are you telling me that i have to purchase a new travel insurance policy to be on the safe side? * yes. sorry. omg.... wtf???!!! how minnesota, which gets cost prohibitive also.', 'Prescription coverage confusion, during 2012 and 2013 i had bc/bs plan-65 blue select c, with a premium of about $150-!60 per mo. and the pdp plan than was an option for an addl cost. these were medicare add-on plans. for 2014 i switched to the bluechip $0 $0 $0 plan. little did i know that during 2012+13 blue cross was picking up a $365 monthly co-pay for my immuno-surpressant meds. before choosing the bluechip $0 0 0 plan i carefully examined every monthly pdp summary and every other summary i received and did not find anywhere that showed the $365 copay being paid. i believed that nedicare part b was covering the immumnosurpressants, which they do in fact cover, but only 80%. so, back in january of 2014, i go to retrive my meds (that cost me 0 for the past 2 years) and the pharmacy asks me for $365.i was stunned! what $365 ? where did this come from? i never saw anything that showed me that this even existed, and certainly nothing showing that this amount was paid by any insurer. i am told that this is the 20% copay that bc/bs was covering in 2012+13. well now if this ($365) is the 20% copay i would expect the total cost to be about $1825. it is not. to make things more confusing...somehow 2 prescriptions costing about $1200 have a 20% copay of $365. must be medical math? luckily for me a very nice transplant coordinator at rih helped me to get a temporary grant from pan (patient access network) to cover the copay, otherwise i would be on a ramen noodle diet. but the problem still exists for me and others like me because immunos are not handled like other meds by the insurance co.s it is difficult to find which plan covers what. and just to confuse things further throw obamacare into the mix. dazed and confused.....joe g.', 'Bc/bs, i have always enjoyed bc/bs insurance even when i lived in ri. it seems to be accepted in a lot of states that i am associated with and it usually has excellent cancelled prior to going on medicare but they withdrew a payment from my bank anyways. automated payments work for them, but they cant return my money by direct deposit. dont have it yet. not transparent because their website doesnt tell me about what is covered, never has. if i ever questioned what coverage i had, they took many calls before sending me any info. last time they sent me coverage info for an affordable healthcare plan, but did not cover me as such, denied claim. when i call about prescription cost, they tell me it will cost so much, but at the pharmacist it is a different cost. prior to the affordable healthcare act, my premiums went up 50% in 2 yrs. while aha was being negotiated, it only went up 1%. interesting at best! after it went up, this last yr it went up 14%, $130 more each month. i thinks it takes a long time when calling because they have so many options and plans that even they dont know whats going on. not transparent on coverage, not trustworthy on many things. glad its over. everyone deserves healthcare, and it should be single payer.', 'Not satisfied with bcbs, i wanted to go for outside university check up but the deductible 'Dont waste your money, bcbs ms used to be good insurance. now, youd better pray you dont have to use it because all they have to do is not approve any treatment plan your doctor provides. they dont IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Alabama
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the ['I have to have this policy as my work provides it. I called customer service this morning as my son is in another city and needed medical treatment. I called the customer service # on the back of my card to find out where he could go that would take my ins. NO ONE could tell me!!! You would think you would have a list of Drs in cities that our insurance would cover. I dont think that is above and beyond. I mean if you dont know how am I suppose to know. I finally just ended up telling him to go to an Urgent Care facility and I would just pay for it. Totally feel like this is the worst customer service EVER.']

IssuerName: QualChoice Life & Health Insurance Company, Inc.

['following hurricane irene, eastern mutual insurance did everything they could to delay or deny paying for damage which destroyed our home. in spite of having a replacement cost policy, we were initially offered 15% of the value of the damaged contents. settlement of the contents portion of the claim took over a year, following constant arguments and deceptive practices on their part. the term good faith does not apply when dealing with this insurance company. after providing all requested receipts, they still refuse to pay for architectural fees, portions of moving costs, and various other expenses. they have also refused to return the holdback of nearly $10,000.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Arizona, Inc.
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am ['Terrible, aetna was one of several choices provided by my employer in this location. i have used them for several years now and i am very disappointed by their claims coverage and customer service. they repeatedly denied claims for services that should be covered (example: pt after surgery - that one should be a no-brainer). i have spent an unbelievable amount of time on the phone and in writing trying unsuccessfully to appeal denials. every time i call about a denied claim, the rep gives me a different story. twice i have filed all the required paperwork, gone through the appeals, been informed that the claim would be covered - only to have the decision reversed again down the line. their strategy seems to be to wear down the customer. in summary, aetna is the best advertisement for a single-payer system that i can think of. if you have any alternative - dont use them.', 'Utterly inconvenient-lame good for nothing coverag, so far....i have paid more than $5000 to doctors out of pocket. this company takes painfully long period to review the case once the patients file is sent for it. i have been calling them since around june to send my case for the review. its end of september now and i found out today that the case had still not been sent because a document was required and pending....which was faxed to them twice almost two months ago and it was confirmed over the phone that it has been received. anyway the agent put me on hold and then came back with the information that document was available with them in the system but the case for review was just not forwarded. i was obviously annoyed and asked why....the agent couldnt kept her cool and said she can only tell me what the system says and theres nothing she can do and that she cant speak for what the previous agents had been telling me. so... two more months if the report actually gets sent....and if it does and if the review is completed in next two months id have waited 5 months just for the review. and if i still after a couple of months find out report was sent for review id have to wait another couple of months because that just is how long it takes for the review process and verifications to complete...and i fear they are going to cover hardly anything the way they have been going about it so far...once the process does get completed....', 'Doesnt cover much, aside from large bill.', 'Appalling, unforgivably bad claims process, ive been insured twice with aetna international while working abroad (first in south africa, then in japan). while the website has evolved somewhat over time, the claims process remains absolutely abysmal. virtually every claim i filed was mishandled in some way and required follow-up, sometimes five or more times for a single claim. sometimes all records of a claim mysteriously disappeared, and aetna said they had no idea what had happened. in these cases, i forwarded them my confirmations of the submissions and they asked me to re-submit everything from scratch since they didnt know what had gone wrong. in other cases, ive had claims which were processed, approved, and supposedly paid out, but cant find any payment corresponding to the date on which they claimed to have paid. when ive asked for confirmation of where the money was sent, they didnt know and said theyd have to investigate. in other cases, payments did come through, but without a clear reference to identify which claims they corresponded to, and aetnas own people couldnt identify which payments corresponded to which claims. this isnt a trivial problem when youre working with foreign currencies whose exchange rates fluctuate. if i submit a claim in yen or euros, its not clear what the corresponding value will be in usd when the reimbursement reaches my us account. and since they sometimes pay out multiple claims in a single lump, this makes it even harder to identify without a detailed reference. ive also encountered numerous cases where they messed up the claim date, leading to further confusion. aetna international is based in the us, but forms submitted abroad typically have the date format reversed (dd/mm). one would think an insurer that caters specifically to expats would have this figured out, but no. if i visit the doctor on april 8, odds are high that theyll input it as august 4 instead.', 'Ffff, sold policy after no problem, with aetna, they refused, aetna is the worst insurance on the planet, they are a complete pos, you pay premiums for what??? oh but when the rep is here at work, she glorifies as if aetna is the best, stay away from the so called insurance company, dont believe their reps, they are just sales people..', 'Aetna health sucks, i made a claim over 6 months ago. aetna has still not paid me the over $200 dollars they owe me. i keep calling and they say they will issue the checks, but i never receive them. yet i have no problem getting their bills.', 'Worst of the worst, unsatisfied! obnoxious crm system. gave my physician a hard way to go. there mottos is collect premiums and pay out as little as they can get away with.', 'Huge premium costs, with minimum benefits, i have aetna health ins. now for my family and i pay over $700 per month, but i have to accept an $8000 deductible. consequently, aetna will not pay for any of my medical costs until i have fulfilled my deductible. i have never maxed out my deductible in the past 2 years. only way to do this would be to have a catastrophic hospital visit. i need lower cost ins, and lower deductible, but aetna refuses to cover me, and will be dropping my policy on dec. 31, 2013. what a waste of money.', 'Convenient, in todays age convenience plays a mayor role. this insurance company is the best. i can select any and ppo option with the plan. do not like the price tag.', 'Satisfied consumer, we had aetna through ibm for a number of years. ibm is getting out of business of providing medical coverage for its retired employees. we need to shop around for coverage in 2014.', 'Patient, 90 % satisfied with this company. would concider another company next year. 90 % satisfied with this company. would concider another company next year.', 'Pretty good, cost is high but excellent customer service.', 'Terrible company, former employer changed my coverage to be covered by aetna. i have never been so medically and financially poor in my life. over the years i was stuck with huge medical bills, several times ive asked for an explanation and nothing until just recently right before changing my choice on my own. i was told between medicare and aetna they only pay 80%. medicare paid 80% and aetna just pennies if anything. my premium steadily increased and i received nothing. in 2010, my medical bills were $10,000.00 and last year again $4,000.00. the elderly are truly discriminated against, we dont take prescriptions as we should for fear we cant afford the next refill, neglect to see the doctor and try to doctor ourselves because we cant afford it and dont eat properly because that is a luxury for those we are paying taxes to care for. this company made me wait forever for a reply, but i continued to receive large hospital bills they would not cover on a timely basis. shame on this insurance company for scamming the elderly and making money off us...and shame on our reps in washington for allowing this! im sick of taking care of the young adults and their children who they take to the doctors constantly for well care visits on my tax dollar. i have been disabled since 2008, have no savings because of my medical and the stress has made my medical conditions even worse. choose another insurance, this one is the worse!', 'Good coverage, it was good coverage. i am not part of group they tell me another. i can’t recommend this health insurance company to any person.', 'Excellent & rare, having consulted businesses for years, not only do i know of what i speak, but i am exponentially more critical than most when weighing a companys operation, including the heart of any business, customer service. this company is the gold standard. in recent years, i continually exhaust my patience when attempting to get information or seek a solution to a problem. every employee i have spoken to has been exemplary. kind, courteous, knowledgeable and efficient - sounds like a paid solicitation, its not. finding and correcting faults, is how i made a living. id go broke with aetna. they do it right. why, you ask, am i being so complimentary? because most businesses think accepting returns is good customer service. the efficiency of aetnas employees are seldom seen today and they deserve credit for their distinguished efforts.', 'Bad. before, much worse now, policy changes without notification, medicine costs by aetna home delivery obnoxiously expensive. i am a veteran and i thought they were good, tricare not available for my wife, they are plain and simple thieves. i hope to god they go bankrupt.', 'Ignorant customer service, due to the fact that hardly anyone at aetna knows what they are doing we have received two different bills that should have been covered by insurance. the first bill was for our babys wellness check at birth and the bill was kicked back to us three times. the billing company said that it was a normal occurrence with aetna insurance. she said they purposely kick bills back...its an automatic setting in their system. she said if we get the bill again then she would send us a form to fill out that they fax or mail to aetna so it doesnt go through their system and is handled by a person. second, due to a switch in insurance companies a bill was not going to be covered by aetna but because aetnas employees did not understand the problem it took them over 15 months to finally let the company know that the bill was not going to be covered by them. 15 months! that meant we could not file it with the other insurance because there is a one year file time. what company needs 15 months to figure out a simple billing problem?', 'Claims never paid, overall i have not been satisfied with aetna. several doctors visits in 2016 were not paid by aetna and they never provided any explanation of why they were not covered. in the end i had to pay over $1250 of claims out of pocket because aetna wouldnt cover the claims and after resubmitting the claim 4x and calling their claims department 6x i simply give up!', 'Horrible care, aetna has denied necessary treatment for my childs auto immune encephalitis . many have the same problem of neglect from duties from aetna . stay away from aetna they are fraudulent and neglectful . or just greedy..', 'Outrageous cost, it started good but my premiums have tripled. i can no longer afford the insulin pump because they dont cover it anymore, barely afford insulin and they cant seem to provide or cover drugs mandated by the aca. i fixing to drop insurance because at this point the cost is the same without it and i will be able to get the drugs i need. this company is a complete scam.', 'Aetna is superlatively unscrupulous,poss. criminal, i have had aetna for over 5 years through my work. like everyone i work with, i loved it...until i needed a doctor. my experience has led me to the thesis that they are unwilling to pay for claims if even the smallest technical problem is seen on the referral or a prescription is very expensive...in which case they require pre-authorization that is impossible to get approved in time in emergency situations (and backdating for reimbursements is a pasquinade to lure you into their premiums). for example, i recently needed a pre-authorization for a prescription that i paid for in an emergency. they take >48 hours to approve pre-auths, even in emergency situations. so, after about a week, i called member services. they told me that my pre-authorization had been approved! yay! however, they wanted me to call the specialty pharmacy to backdate the pre-auth. the rep sounded so genuinely surprised that i was approved that i called him out on it. though he was very nice, told me that he could not help me backdate the pre-auth, and that i should call the pre-auth number. when i did, i was told that there is no record i ever had a pre-auth and that i should call member services. so having come full circle, i called member services and reminded the representative that i had already called 3, and that i was told two days prior that my pre-auth was pending; one day prior i was told (surprisingly) that i was approved; and today i was told no such authorization was ever submitted by the doctor on my behalf. the subterfuge escalated, and i was told there was nobody available to help him find the missing record. he said he would call me back and he never did. i paid $1500 for my medication for the second time without being reimbursed. i wish this event was isolated, but over the past two years ive paid for 2 specialist visits and at least 3 medications out of pocket. the bottom line is: go with aetna only if you never plan on using your expensive health insurance policy!', 'Horrible save yourself, i have had a insurance plan on my son for 10 yrs. he was with another company that was bought out by aetna 2 years ago. on november 16 i called aetna because i heard they were pulling out of the area. when i called, they have confirmed they have the call, they said that his policy was not affected as it was not through the market place. when i called in january to pay his premium payment and was told his policy was cancelled. for the same reason they told me it wasnt affected. i tried to get a new policy quoted and got the run around being transferred all over then told someone would call me. meanwhile my son who takes medication monthly was without insurance and i was told we are sorry that you were given incorrect information and we do have that recorded but there is nothing we can do. so we suffer. luckily i was able to put him on my insurance at work although it is costing me double and affecting our finances since we had not planned on this type of burden. today 01.16.2017 i finally received a call from someone to quote the prices for a new policy, this is 2 weeks later. no thank you! save yourself and dont believe anything they tell you. when they mess up you will pay for it and they will do nothing to assist. they have no problem taking your money though.', 'Good news, aetna will no longer be listed as a choice on the healthcare marketplace. go to wikipedia and look up aetna. there ts a long list of abuses and complaints against them and fines they have paid throughout the years. enough said!', 'You cannot rely on them., aetna once provided me with a very inexpensive aca-grandfathered high-deductible plan. then one day aetna decided it was simply not going to renew my policy, thus leaving me stranded with no health insurance. i was lucky to get into altruas health sharing ministry because i would otherwise now be uninsured. (see also liberty healthshare, medishare, and samaritan ministries for alternatives if you are in a similar situation.) i would never do business with aetna again because it is clear that i cannot rely on them.', 'Don’t get aetna for any coverage of any kind., it is my opinion: years ago, i purchased a long-term and a short term disability policy from aetna through my employer. 2 years ago when i became disabled because of a heart attack and numerous other health issues, verified by 3 doctors. aetna harassed my wife and i, threatened me with job termination, discontinued my pay and benefits, conveniently lost or never received documents my doctors and i sent to them, misreported documented facts, committed fraud, made numerous mistakes in aetna’s favor, told me verbal lies in phone conversations, made outrageous demands under the threat of job termination “if you don’t go to the doctor today and submit these forms you will be terminated from your job”, etc, etc., etc. aetna ceo mark bertolinis compensation was valued at $17.3 million last year. he got it by screwing people like you and me. don’t get aetna for any coverage of any kind.', 'Worst health ins ever, aetna wont approve mri, aetna wants doc to put me on narcotics for a ruptured disc first and physical therapy. i will not be accepting this coverage from my employer when they renew next year. i just hope and pray everyone who works for aetna ends up in the same pain i have. if i were a refugee i would not have to live in this pain.', 'Worst insurance ever, i had to deal with the claim department for short term disability after i had brain surgery and i had the worst experience of my life going from person to person and no one was ever able to satisfied my request for communication with my doctor. i had to do most of their job from my bed while trying to recuperate from a very serious health condition. i would never recommend this insurance to anyone.', 'The only reason why i need insurance is because im getting divorced and cannot be in his plan anymore.', 'Excellent customer service, i had an unexpected health problem and had a heart transplant. aetnas coverage has been fantastic and the customer service has been fantastic. two hospitals have created billing errors on multiple occasions. the hospitals have had problems sorting out their own errors. i call aetna and aetna takes charge of the situation and helps the hospital straighten out their own billing errors. on one occasion, the hospital could not figure out the error they made, and aetna actually figured it out and told the hospital how to correct it in their system. aetna goes above and beyond to help out their patients.', 'An expensive card, i have the aetna health insurance card in my wallet and i thought that it was supposed to help me out with the health care costs sense i pay them and astronomical amount of money every week. well, it really doesnt, my wife and i had a baby this year and if i had not had insurance at all, i would have come out ahead without premiums and deductibles, and coinsurance. they claim to cover postpartum care under the mothers deductible and coinsurance, but really thats a lie, they only cover a few days but not the whole thing. my son was born 5 weeks early and needed to be in nicu for 2 weeks, they coverd the 1st 5 days of his stay under his mothers deductible then split him off onto his own so i have to pay yet another deducible. why do i pay them again? they are not helpful and they cost me a ton of money every year for very little coverage.', 'Okay, want another company quote', 'No longer on insurance, mom is working minimally due to illness,, cobra is 1300 per month. she needs this insurance to keep her doctors but if i have a separate inexpensive IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Florida
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue cross blue sheld more then doubled their rates, and offer the worst insurance coverage ever, their deductables are high, out of pocket high, why have insurance when you pay for everything yourself. their $600.00 a month policy is now $1,700.00 a month. sham sham', 'Isitusal, i took the best policy offered by my employer because i am a cancer survivor and testing is expensive. i also am being treated for depression and the meds i am prescribed are very expensive. however, the cost of just under $105.00 per week is to hard to keep up with along with my co-pays.', 'Ive learned i should pay a little more out of poc, im still seeking insurance that fits my budget.this company has good coverage but am paying a higher premium than i need because i dont have serious health conditions.', 'I always thought this was the best, but the monthly premiums are expensive and now that i am on senior care it seems to cover less than it once did.', 'Decent coverage but controlling, they switched my medication without going through my doctor due to it being cheaper for them. the new medication is not as effective and they declined my switch back to the old medication. currently appealing it.', 'Service sucks!!, i have been having some troubles with ordering prescriptions. the pharmacist wants to charge me 400 bucks after my deductible has been made. i have contacted bcbs several times and nothing has been done. they told me they would have it fixed yesterday, but no one called back. i left 3 messages yesterday with the case manager. can you help? any suggestions? case manager: bonita valles 401-459-5534 case number 4769-20mar17 so, as you can see, the case started on march 20th, but i actually called them a few days before that and they gave me an incomplete case number. i have psoriasis and it gets worse when i cant get my meds and if i get frustrated! well, i am frustrated. i am at the point where i need to get lawyers involved or go to channel 12 or 10.', 'Very costly', 'I detest this co but it is better than my last, clear your entire day if you need to get info from empire bc bs. it is very expensive insurance, you do not get to see the doctors you would like to see (hmo) and dealing with customer service is frustrating at best. you remain on hold forever and are transferred to three different people who put you on hold forever and it leaves such a bad taste in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 why did i have to pay one for 2016. the customer service representative had told me that it was a mistake on their part to charge me early. and that next month in jan i would only need to pay my 2016 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no emails/mail! now, just got off the phone with another representative, a male this time. i saw that my payments this month were still for the new 2017, so i called to see why. the representative this time was unhelpful, he was confused most of the time, kept repeating the same information to me even after i told him several times that what he was telling me had nothing to do with my questions. it ['Horrible health insurance. expensive. bad coverage, i have united health care through my company. i hate it. it is so expensive out of my pocket, and i know my company pays a lot more than i do. the coverage is not great. i have a family of 3. the claims for my son and my husband routinely get denied. they seem to think that they know better what to provide you than your doctor does (the one that actually met with you, examined you and determined the right treatment). i have had to make several appeals for denials of service over the last year and a half. it is crazy all the work you have to go through to have them pay claims. plus the recent two appeals got denied again. so more money out of my pocket! the larger items, are only covered with 50-60 % so you have to pay a bunch there too. dont even get me started on the prescription coverage (its even worse!). i have tried to look at new insurance, but because my company offers health insurance, i was told that when i went to the marketplace, i would not qualify for any credits. really tight spot to be in. i wish i could just fire them. beware of united healthcare. not a good insurance company to deal with.', 'Companie dropping group insurance, i had no problem with unitedhealthcare. its just that our company dropped covering us with any insurance leaving us to find insurance on our own.', 'If they pay zero every claim, what am i paying for, unfortunately i can only get uhc through my employer. i have found that the rx program is a complete scam, and that they indeterminately do not cover medications taht other companies do, or their tier structure is backwards. for medical claims, i had charges for 200 for an xray, they right off 130 (pay 0) and i have to pay 70. when going to urgent care, it would have been cheaper to be un-insured and use the billing structure then to submit to uhc> i paid 54 dolars more than an un-insured person would have paid. i am not sure what my premiums are paying for. they pay zero for every claim, and i get stuck with the bill and the monthly premium. and the quality of doctors that they cover is substandard. i have started looking for a new job that offers a different health insurance carrier.y', 'Never again would i pick this insurance, awful, we had problems with them the whole year. first my son was born at the hospital where my doctor has his office, the hospital stay! later he needed a surgery, took me a long time to make sure that we were covered pick the right doctor and the hospital, everything was covered, we only had $369.00 out of pocket, than a year later we are getting a bill $2600.00, insurance paid but then took money back from the anesthesiologist who is reverse sending bill to me!. you can’t have someone, a year later keep responsible for the bills that you paid! i went through very long process to make sure we were covered. i have had insurance for 23 years, never have i ever experience something like that with any other insurances.', 'Great if you want to be bankrupt., avoid like the plague!!! 9 hours of phone calls to php and 15 transfers. they sent me to their preapproval pcp doctor who preapproved the ortho anything or denying anything.', 'I have no issues with unitedhealthcare, the reason why i am considering a chang is because i have recently lost my job and paying the cobra fee is very expensive.', and believe she should continue outpatient treatment despite the obvious need for a higher level of care. as a board certified physician in texas i am very familiar with medical decision making and the indications for psychiatric admissions. today, i am thoroughly disgusted with unitedhealthcare. now we are posed with a difficult financial choices regarding her psychiatric care with no help from unacceptable.', 'Youll receive minimal care, youll never know what your missing unless youve worked in the health care field as a manager,provider, or director. united covers only minimal poor quality care and services. even with one of their top plans, they must approve every doctors recommendation for such things as surgery, diagnostics etc. you will get the run around and the denials will make no sense. diagnostics must be provided by their network labs and imaging services, which are typically bottom of the barrel. none! none of my doctors will contract with united. among healthcare professionals united healthcare is everyones nightmare. for a middle-aged couple, a mid-grade plan will result in out-of-pocket expenses as high as $44,000 per year. we can thank the government for some of this but they are not solely to blame. i could not in good conscience work at, nor recommend united to anyone. find a provider that offers flexibility. by this i mean things like, no pre-approval, a full sleep study, ice machine after surgery, longer stay time in a care facility, seeing a doc daily or when needed as inpatient, getting the right amount physical therapy instead of a set number of days, and medication that is consistent ( even generic meds can change monthly because the pharmacy will buy from a different manufacturer- the medication is equivalent but not the same and can have unfortunate effects.). these are just some of the things that you will be missing and you wont even know it until you need them. united healthcare is the worst worst worst worst. dont use it, not even as supplemental.', 'Worst insurance ever!!! , i got stuck with this plan united health care and it is horrible they hardly cover shit and no one accepts them i woyld never in my life choose them again and definitely would not recommend it to anyone.', 'The most expensive ripoff in health care, i am an amputee, have been for 26 years, i have had 5 legs built in that time, never a question or problem until i had united oxford as my insuror, i wont bor you with what had to occur over an 18 month period to get my nw leg but i had to hire an attorney at my expense to finally get it done. all because some idiot dicided it was not medically necessary !!!!! i work construction, run heavy machinery my last leg( 2 yrs past its life expectancy was falling apart, and it was not necessary !!! so i should sit home in a whelchair? the worst bar none !! $ appeals later my lawyer brought them before the state to make them give me a leg, thats what i pay almost 2k a month for? stay away from this bs company', 'The worst insurance ever, the worst insurance company i have ever dealt with. my family plan had only $250 deductible and 1500 out of pocket. however that their claims give us a very hard time, they usually refuse to pay any claim and usually find a non-sense excuse.', 'Very expensive, always over rides the doctors recomendations', 'Great short term coverage, 1 or 6 month short term insurance options that are super affordable and offer great coverage', 'Why am i being charged for using my insurance?, the thing that i cannot understand is the amount of money i am paying for insurance; and that money does not even go to what i need insurance for (doctor/hospital visits). i pay a weekly fee for coverage along with a co-pay every time i go to the doctors, and if they need to run some test. united healthcare only covers about 50% of the costs. do not use this insurance unless it is your only option, like most other insurance companies they are greedy.', 'Poor service, i am waiting for an authorizaiton! im in alot of pain and cannot walk very easily. i called 3 days after doc submitted and uhc put a rush on it. 5 days later - still nothing. now they say it takes 2-15 business days---so even with a rush it will take the full 15 days! it is not good service when uhc just lets people suffer! dont get this insurance ever!', 'Cost has become too high, secured ins.thru aarp. very satisfied with service, but income has become smaller and, while we make it w/ithout too much pain, it doesnt hurt to ask.', 'It specialist , i dont have any problems with my present insurance. however, i am concerned about the direction insurance my be headed due to the affordable health act ushered in by obama.', 'Waste of money, i have never had to file a claim with uhc until march 15, 2016. i was hit by a driver who never stopped while riding my bike. uhc refused to pay my medical bills until i was able to hire a lawyer, then they payed only a minimal amount. my lawyer was able to get a small amount of money from the state for people hit by uninsured drivers. now unh has put a lien against me because they are assholes. i was out of work for 6 months and made it threw living on my savings and credit cards. now they want to take what little money i have left and what the state is giving me to help pay my bills. why did i bother to get insurance? do not buy insurance for this company you cant trust them.', 'A bunch of scammers!!!!, on august 8 i found out that my coverage had been cancelled in april, when i called and asked why they said because they had not received any payments even though i paid every month faithfully. so i told the representative that they would not be receiving another dime from me, hung up, and called money gram to see if the money order possibly got lost. the money order was listed as outstanding on the 8th. on august 18th i called money gram again and the same money order that they had not received was listed as being cashed on the 9th of august, the day after i told her they wouldnt be getting any more money from me. coincidence? i think not. i think they were just hoping id repay! do not do business with these scammers! the insurance is crap and so is the customer service. now im waiting to see if theyll really send my refund', 'Very unpleasent expeirence , i had the worst experience ever with unitedhealthcare. during the year 2015, i was covered by aetna health care and i would say that i had a pleasant experience with them. unfortunately, my employer made a contract with united healthcare, choice plus plan at the beginning of 2016 and that was the beginning of the nightmare to every employee. what happens (half the time) is that they will decline the claims and then, you will have to fight to get them to pay for basic covered services by your plan. they will request information from you and they will claim that they have not received anything so they do not pay and will continue to do that until you give up and pay it yourself. since the beginning of 2016 until today, i spent more than $6000 from my own pocket for claims which unitedhealthcare refused to pay because i have not provided them with the requested information from january until today :). if you can find another insurance then, do not hesitate ever, this is the advice from my providers.', 'Bait and switch, beware of uhone. although it terms itself united health care (individual health policies), these policies are actually administered by golden rule insurance, which is known for providing more limited coverage and has more restrictive networks. the uhone policy claims to use the uhc choice plus network, but only once you sign up do you find out that their version of this network, although named the same, has a more restrictive provider list than other uhc choice plus networks. now you are locked in for a year with less coverage than you thought you were paying for. also, you have to pay for all drugs up front and submit bills for them to reimburse later. dont trust what their customer service reps tell you--i have had 4 different people mislead me in the same way as their web info does--they do not use the full uhc choice plus network!', 'Healthcare, i have used united healthacare at work and was satisfied with the doctors and coverage and how my inquiries were handled.', 'Uhc is criminal - hateful, greedy, they change formularies when they think your medications are too expensive. they decide (not your doctor) which medications you should/should not use. their query responses are arrogant and condescending. they gleefully reject claims.', 'They find ways to stall, my wife hurt her back in april 2016 and finally got an mri went to see dr and he said bone spur against nerve needs to be removed. thats when united health care started stalling. if you are a calpers member go somewhere else nothing but trouble here.', 'Good service, good doctors', 'To expensive', 'Cost, when i got this insurance it was cheaper than the one i had and they didnt ask any medical questions. now they are expensive.', 'Billed even after notice of cancellation, my premium increase after 1st year and again for third year until the cost of the insurance was more than a full years supply of medications. i sent a cancellation notice. no response just past due bills. i called. no help there. just a run around. i wrote no response. finally i wrote to attorney general of georgia. got a response from there. they have many complaints. i told united to sue. they could not face me so threatened with collection agency.. over $142.00 that i never owed. beware. they are the worst ever.', 'It is the worst!!!, the company tends to delay my claim for my reimbursement and make the process fairly hard!!! they should know what goes around comes around. go to hell!', 'Pharmacy through optumrx is useless, the uhc pharmacy portion is a joke. 5 prescriptions medications, 3 are the same price with or without insurance (i used a coupon, rather than submitting through insurance, for a better price). the mail order feature that could save you hundreds of dollars a year, and trips to the pharmacy, after 3 weeks i had to give up on. optumrx doesnt accept electronically submitted scripts from university of california davis, medical center? of the 2 remaining prescriptions, 1 is not covered at all ($1296.00) for a 90-day supply and the 5th, (last) prescription is not eligible for mail-order? my out-of pocket prescription costs went from $120 a month at my local grocery store to over $1400 a month with my own coupons at 2 different locations. the only money and time saved is at uhcs end. they dont have to do anything, which i am sure suits them just fine, collect my premiums and provide no services? if you want to pay for your own prescriptions and clip coupons to redeem at multiple locations this is your company! if you want prescription drug coverage i strongly urge you to look elsewhere, this company is slow to respond, cherry picks what is and is not covered, and in the long run the policyholder pays much more out of pocket. the medical portion of coverage i can not yet comment on, aside from the co-pay is 33% higher for a family practice office visit. thankfully i was not due for my annual screening labs and mammogram. summary: i would be better served if i applied for california care; lower premiums and lower deductibles/co-pays!', 'Need quote for grandson - i will be retiring soon and will have medicare. he is currently insured under my insurance thru work will need individual policy for grandson - i am his guardian', 'Searching for affordable health insurace, i need to save money so i am cutting down costs everywhere', 'I am confused. just looking for an insurance company. dont know what is best. i am cancer free now but want a company that is accepted by sloan kettering. dont know if my answers are correct. need to speak with someone. i gave 5 stars for all but really have no clue', 'Great company, i have been very happy with united health care', 'Canceled pcp , canceled ochsner in our state as a health care provider after they couldnt agree on a contract. this is the only real healthcare option in our area and has been for a while. this is after only 4 months being with them. no warning , nothing. seems disingenuous at best, fraudulent at worst. why didnt they tell us this was a liklihood before signing us up.', 'Horrible, lost premium for a whole month!, lost our first payment for a whole month. offered to move effective date to feb 1st which i dont want', 'Truly awful at handling wrong claims, i have spent so many hours on chat and on the phone with over 7 different people who seemingly cant understand my problem. ive had to explain it so many different times. ill give you a couple examples. today (the final straw), i finally got through to a supervisor who understood my issue - that the bill i received from my doctor was billed as medical, not preventative. the uhc employee said theyd handle it. they called the doctor, and when the doctor said it was medical, they *just accepted the doctors word for it*. they didnt try to argue my case (that it was my annual physical, it was obviously preventative). they just said oh okay and called me. when i said they were wrong, they acted all surprised even though i had *just explained this to them on the phone*. other times i have completely explained my problem in chat, with dates and bill amounts, only fifteen seconds later to have my chat representative ask for the dates and bill amounts. its like no one is listening at all. i had to end up paying the claim because it had been four months and was about to start hitting my credit score.', 'Retiree insurance running out, i need some short term insurance to do me until my medicare starts from march until june or july', 'I want to remain with united health care, i want to stay but the plan is ending. call me. 301-775-4632. i live in maryland', 'Worst ever, this company is one of the worst insurance companies i have ever dealt with. i cannot believe how they treat their customers!', 'Very disapppointed., i have had united healthcare for at least14 years through my employer and have been very satisfied with my health care coverage until now. i have sought treatment for alcohol dependence through an intensive outpatient program to get sober and save my life and my family. i am in my 8th week of a ten week program and have been sober for 30 days and feel the best i have felt in years. last week i was told by my treatment program director that united healthcare has only approved 19 sessions of a 30 session program and they felt that this program was just like an inpatient program and they wouldnt approve more than 19 sessions. my program director said that this is common with united healthcare and they often deny full coverage for substance abuse recovery programs. i had to already pay $640.00 out of my own pocket for this program to meet my out of pocket maximum and i dont know how im going to be able to pay for the 11 remaining sessions. this is very frustrating i have always felt that i had the best health insurance around that cared about its customers. but in this instance they clearly do not. they pay to get my started and well into my treatment than they say sorry we will not cover you for the remainder of your treatment that in my case if very important for my well being. i guess they only care about making money off me not fulfilling their responsibility to cover me for treatment i so greatly need. im so disappointed in you united healthcare.', 'They donot accept many prescription drug medicines, they would not cover my pay. uhc also did not pay my mammogram radiologist. our premiums tripled this year; we have doctors and hospitals that were dropped by uhc in january, so we have to pay out of pocket to them. uhcs ceo made record profits this year because this is how they treat their members: charge them outrageous premiums, refuse to pay when members need to use their insurance; drop hospitals, facilities, and doctors mid-year so members are forced to pay uhc and pay out-of-pocket to doctors. uhc is unethical; they force you to hold their insurance a year, yet they drop your doctors and hospitals soon after your contract begins. they do not honor your contracts-if there is another insurance option for you, choose the other option.', 'Worst claim service ever, my policy states i have no maximum number of
