letter. this has been going on for 4 months and yet i cant talk to anyone about it, they refuse to let me talk to anyone when i ask to talk to someone who can help me. complete incompetence.', 'Suck, impossible to get a hold of the right person, company is a joke have to make sure they bill it and not denied', 'Difficult to use, just incredibly difficult to get any help if you need it. their call my empleyer to tell them to put me to work with restriction,doctor gived me 6 weeks and united healthcare wanted me to come back to work 2 weeks after i had my surgery so they dont have to pay me anything wish is not fare for me been paying this insurance for 5 years and when i need it dont get anything,i just come back to work and still waiting have to go with doctor to get a note to come back at early time couse my bills and stuff was on top of my haed already.', 'Horrible, the claim process is archaic. long waits on phone calls then get bounced around without getting questions ['Supplement to medicare, i am disabled and get ssdi. i can only work 15 hours a week. last year my total income for the year 2014 was $2,000. i need to get cheaper health insurance for my two boys. costs. plus they cover doctor visits with only a $10.00 co-pay. when i have to call every one is polite and very helpful.', 'Humana, it is a great company i am already insured with them already. thank you anyway.i have health isurance with them but would like to have for child health insurance if i can get it cheap.', 'Incompetent , rude, ineffectual, unskilled group, if at all possible do not use this company. rather than give a list of all the things they cant do let me give a list of the only thing they can. they will take your money and refuse to pay for most if not all the health claims you submit. if i had the time and money i would start a class action suit who knows maybe after my wife dies because she cant get the treat she needs i will. this company really needs to pay or at the very least be destroyed.', 'Dont use humana!, if you live in vancouver wa, dont sign up for humana! they do not have any primary care physicians in this area so now im stuck without health care for the year and cant transfer to another plan!', 'Request validation of need for additional insuranc, i am retired from the university of california, and am and air force retiree. i have tricare for life and i have supplemental insurance through the university, at the same time i am on medicare. my question is do i need the additional supplemental health insurance recommended by tricare?', 'I find it probing, i may not be seeing this in the proper way but it seams geared at selling me insurance which i cant afford.', 'There a scam. , i did not see anywhere it said i was locked in for a year with them. but now we are stuck being robbed for a year. please please dont loose your money on this scam its a joke. no one is in there network and the ones that are. say they are dropping them as fast as they can. please save your self from this theft.', 'They will do whatever it takes to keep from paying, humana will do whatever it takes to keep from paying a medical claim, no matter what medical documentation is supplied to support the claim. the only thing they care about is money.', 'Great coveragethey have great costumer service, they have great service at a low cost i like the coverage. i wish they still had service in my area.', 'Good, it told me what i needed to know in an understandable way. it asked the right questions at the right times.', 'Medical comparison and need dental, im inquiring about other medical insurance coverage for the sake of comparison. i dont have dental coverage and would like quotes on those available.', 'Great insurance company, humana one is a pretty good insurance company. i have been with humana now for about four years with out any difficulties ; however,for the past couple of years the rate has gone up extraordinarily', 'Not sure y humana told me i had 2 find new insur, ive been happy with humana. they told me i had to find new insurance, which i still dont understand why.', 'George toth, the insurance has been great but im currently shopping for new rates.', 'New plan costs toooo much', 'Payment of claim, good response with explanation and payment of insurance for services.', 'Good company, they are a good company but there over all cost are to hi. alot prescription drugs are not listed, that i would be taken if it was not for the costs. copays: should not have any co pays for the price i pay monthly for medical and drugs.all company costs are way out of line.', 'Cost, i want to find out if i can my daughter,who is 13 years old', 'Affordable care act forcing change, affordable care act is forcing a change in my coverage (against my wishes)', 'Better policy, better price', 'Policy is too expesive, my wife has the cost of my insurance deducted from her retirement chack and the increase will be taking 40% of her monthly checkin 2014.', 'Company provided,']

IssuerName: Kaiser Foundation Health Plan of Georgia
Reviews: ['After being on Kaiser from the age of six months to now at 58 and never having a problem, all that has changed. In the last few years the rates have gone up and up and service has gotten worse. Its all about the money. I have a chronic, painful condition- arthritis in my neck (diagnosed by a Kaiser Dr.) and TMJ. I have had an RX for a pain med and muscle relaxer for years, which was used only as needed and sparingly. I was sent a notice recently that they had assigned me a new Dr. after years of seeing the old one who never gave me a problem with refills. I recently sent in a refill request for my meds and the request was denied saying I had to come in for lab tests and an evaluation to determine if I actually had the condition and or if it still existed What??? NO! Im not stupid and know Arthritis and TMJ do not resolve. They are permanant conditions and lab tests etc. are NOT necessary for these conditions. They only want me to come in and pay the MUCH higher than before co-pays to run tests that are not necessary and are worthless as far as my conditions. They kept me going through tons of red tape and hearings I didnt request only to keep denying me my meds. NO more Kaiser for us. We are leaving and going to a new health plan. Kaiser is no longer the good company it once was. Now its corporate greed.']

IssuerName: Coventry Health Care of Iowa Inc.
Blue Cross Blue Shield of Illinois
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas City
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no emails/mail! now, just got off the phone with another representative, a male this time. i saw that my payments this month were still for the new 2017, so i called to see why. the representative this time was unhelpful, he was confused most of the time, kept repeating the same information to me even after i told him several times that what he was telling me had nothing to do with my questions. it was stressful. the guy told me in the most round-about-way why i must pay my 2017 premium this month, and repeatedly kept avoiding my concerns. according to the new representative, the other representative i talked to (the lady) was wrong! you pay a month in advance. i am new to insurances, so this may be the correct, maybe this guy lied, i dont know. but someone lied to me. and i wanted someone to look into my conversation with the lady. i asked him if blue shield records conversations, he said yes after several attempts to avoid this question. but here is the best part, my previous conversation with the lady was not recorded. how convenient. he said he looked it up and doesn’t see a recording. she didn’t log in her location at the time. they cant trace the call without that or the $365 copay being paid. i believed that nedicare part b was covering the immumnosurpressants, which they do in fact cover, but only 80%. so, back in january of 2014, i go to retrive my meds (that cost me 0 for the past 2 years) and the pharmacy asks me for $365.i was stunned! what $365 ? where did this come from? i never saw anything that showed me that this even existed, and certainly nothing showing that this amount was paid by any insurer. i am told that this is the 20% copay that bc/bs was covering in 2012+13. well now if this ($365) is the 20% copay i would expect the total cost to be ['Horrible health insurance. expensive. bad coverage, i have united health care through my company. i hate it. it is so expensive out of my pocket, and i know my company pays a lot more than i do. the ['We were sold this cancer policy by a friend of ours. We were sold the summary not the actual policy. We were told this was the best policy on the market----were we misinformed!!! It seems that everything has a $5,000 max lifetime cap. The policies we had did NOT have this cap. Shame on me for trusting this agent/friend. We had the cancer and the dreaded disease policy. My wife has had cancer and I had quadruple by-pass surgery within the last 12 months. Their customer service is deplorable! They dont appear to have a clue as to what they are doing. We started filing October 2016 and are still getting the run-around about our claims. They constantly need more/different information from what we provide---I think it is so they wont have to pay the claims. We have received a few checks from them but we still have quite a few more that we should receive--we think. We cant get a straight answer from them and they always say that someone will look at our claim within 15 business days. That turns into a month at least. We still have claims for rehab, travel, etc to file but were afraid to muddy the water until we get what they already have settled. I think we will have to actually get an attorney involved to get our claims resolved. This company is the WORST I have EVER dealt with. I would not recommend them to anyone. I feel that we have been lied too and mislead by the agent, by the customer service dept, by the policy holder service dept and anyone else that we will speak with in the future. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS INSURANCE COMPANY!!!!']

IssuerName: Anthem Health Plans of ME(Anthem BCBS)
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the ['They have the best customer service. Since day one all my issues have been handled appropriately and immediately. Not only do they call for an update but they also follow-up with a letter. Kudos to Mr. Joseph Tierney of the Appeals Dept. thank you so much for your help.']

['After being on Kaiser from the age of six months to now at 58 and never having a problem, all that has changed. In the last few years the rates have gone up and up and service has gotten worse. Its all about the money. I have a chronic, painful condition- arthritis in my neck (diagnosed by a Kaiser Dr.) and TMJ. I have had an RX for a pain med and muscle relaxer for years, which was used only as needed and sparingly. I was sent a notice recently that they had assigned me a new Dr. after years of seeing the old one who never gave me a problem with refills. I recently sent in a refill request for my meds and the request was denied saying I had to come in for lab tests and an evaluation to determine if I actually had the condition and or if it still existed What??? NO! Im not stupid and know Arthritis and TMJ do not resolve. They are permanant conditions and lab tests etc. are NOT necessary for these conditions. They only want me to come in and pay the MUCH higher than before co-pays to run tests that are not necessary and are worthless as far as my conditions. They kept me going through tons of red tape and hearings I didnt request only to keep denying me my meds. NO more Kaiser for us. We are leaving and going to a new health plan. Kaiser is no longer the good company it once was. Now its corporate greed.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan Mutual Insurance Company
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the IssuerName: Meridian Health Plan of Michigan, Inc.
Reviews: ['Horrible health insurance. expensive. bad coverage, i have united health care through my company. i hate it. it is so expensive out of my pocket, and i know my company pays a lot more than i do. the coverage is not great. i have a family of 3. the claims for my son and my husband routinely get denied. they seem to think that they know better what to provide you than your doctor does (the one that actually met with you, examined you and determined the right treatment). i have had to make several appeals for denials of service over the last year and a half. it is crazy all the work you have to go through to have them pay claims. plus the recent two appeals got denied again. so more money out of my pocket! the larger items, are only covered with 50-60 % so you have to pay a bunch there too. dont even get me started on the prescription coverage (its even worse!). i have tried to look at new insurance, but because my company offers health insurance, i was told that when i went to the marketplace, i would not qualify for any credits. really tight spot to be in. i wish i could just fire them. beware of united healthcare. not a good insurance company to deal with.', 'Companie dropping group insurance, i had no problem with unitedhealthcare. its just that our company dropped covering us with any insurance leaving us to find insurance on our own.', 'If they pay zero every claim, what am i paying for, unfortunately i can only get uhc through my employer. i have found that the rx program is a complete scam, and that they indeterminately do not cover medications taht other companies do, or their tier structure is backwards. for medical claims, i had charges for 200 for an xray, they right off 130 (pay 0) and i have to pay 70. when going to urgent care, it would have been cheaper to be un-insured and use the billing structure then to submit to uhc> i paid 54 dolars more than an un-insured person would have paid. i am not sure what my premiums are paying for. they pay zero for every claim, and i get stuck with the bill and the monthly premium. and the quality of doctors that they cover is substandard. i have started looking for a new job that offers a different health insurance carrier.y', 'Never again would i pick this insurance, awful, we had problems with them the whole year. first my son was born at the hospital where my doctor has his office, that’s the only hospital he delivers babies. when i asked if we were covered i got the confirmation only to find out at the hospital next day after birth of my son that the doctor was covered but not the hospital stay! later he needed a surgery, took me a long time to make sure that we were covered pick the right doctor and the hospital, everything was covered, we only had $369.00 out of pocket, than a year later we are getting a bill $2600.00, insurance paid but then took money back from the anesthesiologist who is reverse sending bill to me!. you can’t have someone, a year later keep responsible for the bills that you paid! i went through very long process to make sure we were covered. i have had insurance for 23 years, never have i ever experience something like that with any other insurances.', 'Great if you want to be bankrupt., avoid like the plague!!! 9 hours of phone calls to php and 15 transfers. they sent me to their preapproval pcp doctor who preapproved the ortho removing an arm cast? they then denied payment to the specialist they preapproved for removing the cast. the pcp and specialist both resubmitted and showed me the denials. uhc denied receiving anything or denying anything.', 'I have no issues with unitedhealthcare, the reason why i am considering a chang is because i have recently lost my job and paying the cobra fee is very expensive.', 'Dropped my drs and hospitals in mid year, i do not recommend united healthcare. they dropped our doctors and hospitals in july of my annual contract with united. had they been transparent about negotiations with my regions hospital, i could have made a more informed healthcare decision. my doctors and hospital are now out of network. and they pay 0 towards my appointments. when choosing my insurance i checked that my doctors were indeed in network. i placed calls to united to verify, and was assured they were. new nearest hospital and drs that are in network are 2 hours away. they have no concern for patients, only their profit. it is unethical and unacceptable to treat patients as they do. we are stuck with virtually no insurance for 6 more months, yet we continue to be charged monthly dues. stay away from united', 'Disgusting, today unitedhealthcare refused to cover any costs associated with my daughters residential psychiatric/dbt treatment. my 15yr old daughter has bipolar disorder and has had multiple psychiatric admissions over the past 12 months. she has had 3 suicide attempts and is failing outpatient psychiatric treatment. somehow they denied any coverage and believe she should continue outpatient treatment despite the obvious need for a higher level of care. as a board certified physician in texas i am very familiar with medical decision making and the indications for psychiatric admissions. today, i am thoroughly disgusted with unitedhealthcare. now we are posed with a difficult financial choices regarding her psychiatric care with no help from our insurance company. in healthcare we all have to take a financial loss from time to time while caring for patients, especially in life or death situations. unfortunately unitedhealthcare is more concerned about denying care and reporting profits than taking care of people.', 'Warning!!!!! if you choose united health care, as of now have been on hold for 2 hours 12 min. , 25 sec. and counting. at this point im just waiting toes how long they will actually take. when i first called they said that the wait time was 8 mins!!!!! they charge a lot for very little coverage. they denied medical equipment that my dr. prescribed!! very high copayment for drugs. i dont have the time to talk about all of it. do not even consider it.', 'Would like to stay with them, moving at end of month to nj. address will not be cover by pa access card need to find policy for nj would like to stay with united health', 'Good, was a great health care program my company i worked for at the time went out of business', 'Mr mavrik ohanjanyan, first of all cost was less, than other options. policy provided better coverage and more policy options available. easy personal assistance from agent so far. it was recommended by a friend and i am very thankful himâ€¦ thank you.', 'Wished premiums were less, very good insurance . wished the premiums were less', 'Railroad policy through husband policy running out do to his age 65', 'Buyer beware!, i will never buy insurance from this company again. too much to list here, but i didnt get my card until the 29th day of the 1st month of coverage, and then it was one run around after another for everything. consider yourself warned.', 'Bait and switch, while united healthcare seemed to be a reasonable choice, i will never go back to these scumbags. arrogant representatives trained to be judge, jury and executioner, and comfortable, even happy to say no, as if to say tough luck! i pay them gobs of money, never use the insurance, then get screwed when asking for the very thing i pay them for. they have a very bad attitude toward their customers. drop me without any notice 24 days ago, and explain that they didnt have to notify me, it is buried in the legalese of a 40 page contract, that they dont have to be fair, or reasonable to their clients. these kind of companies must go to lengths to find hatchet men to do their dirty work. except in my case it was an arrogant mean woman who seemed to enjoy telling to effectively, go f yourself. they dont have to be reasonable, because they can do anything they want and hide behind lawyers, and the fine print, to escape their responsibilities. they give their customers attitude instead of respect and the care you pay for. stay away from companies like united healthcare who find these miserable people to do their dirty work for them and leave customers holding a bag of crap, spending money on a system of corruption.', 'Great company , my wifes company was bought out and we had to move from cigna to unitedhealth care. shortly after the switch i had major brain surgery at a top neurological center in phoenix by a world renounce surgeon. i received 2 bills in the mail one for the neurological institute and the other from the hospital. after my deductible was met i was responsible for about $600.00 dollars total. the hospital bill was 145k and the surgeons bill was about 20k. had non problem with united at all. great company wasnt sure how the switch was going to be, but very satisfied.', 'Gabage, now i understand why uhc has bad reputation. i only got routine eye exam that is covered by insurance company. but later they said that the eye exam fee will be covered when the exam result shows the eyes are perfect. i have to pay exam fee because i got diagnosis myopia even though i did not get any treatment. policy never mentioned that exam result should be perfect to get coverage.', 'Dropped by obamacare , we were dropped by obamacare an have no option in the county where we live now.', 'Worst provider on the market, there is no generic of my birth control available. under the affordable care act if this is the case the insurance company must provide the brand name. they made me file an appeal. i get all the details of exactly what they need, i then contact a womans rights law office to make sure i do it correctly. it took a month for them to process (even though it was marked urgent). i call regularly to get the results asap- they cannot tell me anything over the phone. i finally get a letter in the mail that my appeal was denied and they need a letter from the doctor. my doctor had sent them a letter almost a month prior. they tell me theres nothing i can do- i cant speak with the appeal department. in the mean time i try to get a list of birth controls available at no cost to me. after an hours i am provided with one. (getting disconnected, having to call back, one rep cant figure out where the list is online and cant email it or fax it to me, then their manager is finally able to guide me to it). i get my doctor to prescribe me one that is on the list. then call the pharmacy the next day and the charge is $77.99. i call uhc back- they say there is no list. i have been on hold now for 30 minutes trying to find out what is available to me at no copay.', 'Beware , do not use united health!, they do not and will not pay any claims, i dont know how they can get away with this. i get a different excuse from them every time i call to see why my claim is not being paid, literally a different excuse each time. i will not renew , and changing insurance is the worst financial mistake of my life.', 'Horrible insurance, worst insurance company ever!! they dont want to pay for anything, they play the blame game on blaming the doctors office for everything. things that are supposed to be covered 100% they refuse to pay. blue cross blue shield is a whole lot better company. never had these issues when we were with them. i would not ever recommend this company to anyone ever ever ever. for almost 2 years now its been the most horrible fight with them to do anything. i wouldnt give this insurance to my worst enemy, that is how bad it is. pay a fortune for it, and they dont pay anything. doesnt matter that they are in network. 180 dollar doctor bill and they paid 3 dollars. dont waste your time with this company. they are worthless as they come.', 'I just want a quote, all i am trying to do is get a quote, this is the 3rd page of filling out my personal information and i still do not have a quote. this is getting ridiculous !!!', 'Aarp united health care is dropping my doctor.', 'Inadequate, i set up autopay and it worked for 2 months. a couple months after that, i find out my account was terminated. no notice. nothing. i get the account reinstated...or did i? one person tells me yes, another tells me technically no. 3 conversations later, im told i am covered through this month, but my account hasnt been reinstated. what? poor customer service. terrible business practice. unacceptable.', 'Youll receive minimal care, youll never know what your missing unless youve worked in the health care field as a manager,provider, or director. united covers only minimal poor quality care and services. even with one of their top plans, they must approve every doctors recommendation for such things as surgery, diagnostics etc. you will get the run around and the denials will make no sense. diagnostics must be provided by their network labs and imaging services, which are typically bottom of the barrel. none! none of my doctors will contract with united. among healthcare professionals united healthcare is everyones nightmare. for a middle-aged couple, a mid-grade plan will result in out-of-pocket expenses as high as $44,000 per year. we can thank the government for some of this but they are not solely to blame. i could not in good conscience work at, nor recommend united to anyone. find a provider that offers flexibility. by this i mean things like, no pre-approval, a full sleep study, ice machine after surgery, longer stay time in a care facility, seeing a doc daily or when needed as inpatient, getting the right amount physical therapy instead of a set number of days, and medication that is consistent ( even generic meds can change monthly because the pharmacy will buy from a different manufacturer- the medication is equivalent but not the same and can have unfortunate effects.). these are just some of the things that you will be missing and you wont even know it until you need them. united healthcare is the worst worst worst worst. dont use it, not even as supplemental.', 'Worst insurance ever!!! , i got stuck with this plan united health care and it is horrible they hardly cover shit and no one accepts them i woyld never in my life choose them again and definitely would not recommend it to anyone.', 'The most expensive ripoff in health care, i am an amputee, have been for 26 years, i have had 5 legs built in that time, never a question or problem until i had united oxford as my insuror, i wont bor you with what had to occur over an 18 month period to get my nw leg but i had to hire an attorney at my expense to finally get it done. all because some idiot dicided it was not medically necessary !!!!! i work construction, run heavy machinery my last leg( 2 yrs past its life expectancy was falling apart, and it was not necessary !!! so i should sit home in a whelchair? the worst bar none !! $ appeals later my lawyer brought them before the state to make them give me a leg, thats what i pay almost 2k a month for? stay away from this bs company', 'The worst insurance ever, the worst insurance company i have ever dealt with. my family plan had only $250 deductible and 1500 out of pocket. however that their claims give us a very hard time, they usually refuse to pay any claim and usually find a non-sense excuse.', 'Very expensive, always over rides the doctors recomendations', 'Great short term coverage, 1 or 6 month short term insurance options that are super affordable and offer great coverage', 'Why am i being charged for using my insurance?, the thing that i cannot understand is the amount of money i am paying for insurance; and that money does not even go to what i need insurance for (doctor/hospital visits). i pay a weekly fee for coverage along with a co-pay every time i go to the doctors, and if they need to run some test. united healthcare only covers about 50% of the costs. do not use this insurance unless it is your only option, like most other insurance companies they are greedy.', 'Poor service, i am waiting for an authorizaiton! im in alot of pain and cannot walk very easily. i called 3 days after doc submitted and uhc put a rush on it. 5 days later - still nothing. now they say it takes 2-15 business days---so even with a rush it will take the full 15 days! it is not good service when uhc just lets people suffer! dont get this insurance ever!', 'Cost has become too high, secured ins.thru aarp. very satisfied with service, but income has become smaller and, while we make it w/ithout too much pain, it doesnt hurt to ask.', 'It specialist , i dont have any problems with my present insurance. however, i am concerned about the direction insurance my be headed due to the affordable health act ushered in by obama.', 'Waste of money, i have never had to file a claim with uhc until march 15, 2016. i was hit by a driver who never stopped while riding my bike. uhc refused to pay my medical bills until i was able to hire a lawyer, then they payed only a minimal amount. my lawyer was able to get a small amount of money from the state for people hit by uninsured drivers. now unh has put a lien against me because they are assholes. i was out of work for 6 months and made it threw living on my savings and credit cards. now they want to take what little money i have left and what the state is giving me to help pay my bills. why did i bother to get insurance? do not buy insurance for this company you cant trust them.', 'A bunch of scammers!!!!, on august 8 i found out that my coverage had been cancelled in april, when i called and asked why they said because they had not received any payments even though i paid every month faithfully. so i told the representative that they would not be receiving another dime from me, hung up, and called money gram to see if the money order possibly got lost. the money order was listed as outstanding on the 8th. on august 18th i called money gram again and the same money order that they had not received was listed as being cashed on the 9th of august, the day after i told her they wouldnt be getting any more money from me. coincidence? i think not. i think they were just hoping id repay! do not do business with these scammers! the insurance is crap and so is the customer service. now im waiting to see if theyll really send my refund', 'Very unpleasent expeirence , i had the worst experience ever with unitedhealthcare. during the year 2015, i was covered by aetna health care and i would say that i had a pleasant experience with them. unfortunately, my employer made a contract with united healthcare, choice plus plan at the beginning of 2016 and that was the beginning of the nightmare to every employee. what happens (half the time) is that they will decline the claims and then, you will have to fight to get them to pay for basic covered services by your plan. they will request information from you and they will claim that they have not received anything so they do not pay and will continue to do that until you give up and pay it yourself. since the beginning of 2016 until today, i spent more than $6000 from my own pocket for claims which unitedhealthcare refused to pay because i have not provided them with the requested information from january until today :). if you can find another insurance then, do not hesitate ever, this is the advice from my providers.', 'Bait and switch, beware of uhone. although it terms itself united health care (individual health policies), these policies are actually administered by golden rule insurance, which is known for providing more limited coverage and has more restrictive networks. the uhone policy claims to use the uhc choice plus network, but only once you sign up do you find out that their version of this network, although named the same, has a more restrictive provider list than other uhc choice plus networks. now you are locked in for a year with less coverage than you thought you were paying for. also, you have to pay for all drugs up front and submit bills for them to reimburse later. dont trust what their customer service reps tell you--i have had 4 different people mislead me in the same way as their web info does--they do not use the full uhc choice plus network!', 'Healthcare, i have used united healthacare at work and was satisfied with the doctors and coverage and how my inquiries were handled.', 'Uhc is criminal - hateful, greedy, they change formularies when they think your medications are too expensive. they decide (not your doctor) which medications you should/should not use. their query responses are arrogant and condescending. they gleefully reject claims.', 'They find ways to stall, my wife hurt her back in april 2016 and finally got an mri went to see dr and he said bone spur against nerve needs to be removed. thats when united health care started stalling. if you are a calpers member go somewhere else nothing but trouble here.', 'Good service, good doctors', 'To expensive', 'Cost, when i got this insurance it was cheaper than the one i had and they didnt ask any medical questions. now they are expensive.', 'Billed even after notice of cancellation, my premium increase after 1st year and again for third year until the cost of the insurance was more than a full years supply of medications. i sent a cancellation notice. no response just past due bills. i called. no help there. just a run around. i wrote no response. finally i wrote to attorney general of georgia. got a response from there. they have many complaints. i told united to sue. they could not face me so threatened with collection agency.. over $142.00 that i never owed. beware. they are the worst ever.', 'It is the worst!!!, the company tends to delay my claim for my reimbursement and make the process fairly hard!!! they should know what goes around comes around. go to hell!', 'Pharmacy through optumrx is useless, the uhc pharmacy portion is a joke. 5 prescriptions medications, 3 are the same price with or without insurance (i used a coupon, rather than submitting through insurance, for a better price). the mail order feature that could save you hundreds of dollars a year, and trips to the pharmacy, after 3 weeks i had to give up on. optumrx doesnt accept electronically submitted scripts from university of california davis, medical center? of the 2 remaining prescriptions, 1 is not covered at all ($1296.00) for a 90-day supply and the 5th, (last) prescription is not eligible for mail-order? my out-of pocket prescription costs went from $120 a month at my local grocery store to over $1400 a month with my own coupons at 2 different locations. the only money and time saved is at uhcs end. they dont have to do anything, which i am sure suits them just fine, collect my gram to see if the money order possibly got lost. the money order was listed as outstanding on the 8th. on august 18th i called money gram again and the same money order that they had not received was listed as being cashed on the 9th of august, the day after i told her they wouldnt be getting any more money from me. coincidence? i think not. i think they were just hoping id repay! do not do business with these scammers! the insurance is crap and so is the customer service. now im waiting to see if theyll really send my refund', 'Very unpleasent expeirence , i had the worst experience ever with unitedhealthcare. during the year 2015, i was covered by aetna health care and i would say that i had a pleasant experience with them. unfortunately, my employer made a contract with united healthcare, choice plus plan at the beginning of 2016 and that was the beginning of the nightmare to every employee. what happens (half the time) is that they will decline the claims and then, you will have to fight to get them to pay for basic covered services by your plan. they will request information from you and they will claim that they have not received anything so they do not pay and will continue to do that until you give up and pay it yourself. since the beginning of 2016 until today, i spent more than $6000 from my own pocket for claims which unitedhealthcare refused to pay because i have not provided them with the requested information from january until today :). if you can find another insurance then, do not hesitate ever, this is the advice from my providers.', 'Bait and switch, beware of uhone. although it terms itself united health care (individual health policies), these policies are actually administered by golden rule insurance, which is known for providing more limited coverage and has more restrictive networks. the uhone policy claims to use the uhc choice plus network, but only once you sign up do you find out that their version of this network, although named the same, has a more restrictive provider list than other uhc choice plus networks. now you are locked in for a year with less coverage than you thought you were paying for. also, you have to pay for all drugs up front and submit bills for them to reimburse later. dont trust what their customer service reps tell you--i have had 4 different people mislead me in the same way as their web info does--they do not use the full uhc choice plus network!', 'Healthcare, i have used united healthacare at work and was satisfied with the doctors and coverage and how my inquiries were handled.', 'Uhc is criminal - hateful, greedy, they change formularies when they think your medications are too expensive. they decide (not your doctor) which medications you should/should not use. their query responses are arrogant and condescending. they gleefully reject claims.', 'They find ways to stall, my wife hurt her back in april 2016 and finally got an mri went to see dr and he said bone spur against nerve needs to be removed. thats when united health care started stalling. if you are a calpers member go somewhere else nothing but trouble here.', 'Good service, good doctors', 'To expensive', 'Cost, when i got this insurance it was cheaper than the one i had and they didnt ask any medical questions. now they are expensive.', 'Billed even after notice of cancellation, my premium increase after 1st year and again for third year until the cost of the insurance was more than a full years supply of medications. i sent a cancellation notice. no response just past due bills. i called. no help there. just a run around. i wrote no response. finally i wrote to attorney general of georgia. got a response from there. they have many complaints. i told united to sue. they could not face me so threatened with collection agency.. over $142.00 that i never owed. beware. they are the worst ever.', 'It is the worst!!!, the company tends to delay my claim for my reimbursement and make the process fairly hard!!! they should know what goes around comes around. go to hell!', 'Pharmacy through optumrx is useless, the uhc pharmacy portion is a joke. 5 prescriptions medications, 3 are the same price with or without insurance (i used a coupon, rather than submitting through insurance, for a better price). the mail order feature that could save you hundreds of dollars a year, and trips to the pharmacy, after 3 weeks i had to give up on. optumrx doesnt accept electronically submitted scripts from university of california davis, medical center? of the 2 remaining prescriptions, 1 is not covered at all ($1296.00) for a 90-day supply and the 5th, (last) prescription is not eligible for mail-order? my out-of pocket prescription costs went from $120 a month at my local grocery store to over $1400 a month with my own coupons at 2 different locations. the only money and time saved is at uhcs end. they dont have to do anything, which i am sure suits them just fine, collect my premiums and provide no services? if you want to pay for your own prescriptions and clip coupons to redeem at multiple locations this is your company! if you want prescription drug coverage i strongly urge you to look elsewhere, this company is slow to respond, cherry picks what is and is not covered, and in the long run the policyholder pays much more out of pocket. the medical portion of coverage i can not yet comment on, aside from the co-pay is 33% higher for a family practice office visit. thankfully i was not due for my annual screening labs and mammogram. summary: i would be better served if i applied for california care; lower premiums and lower deductibles/co-pays!', 'Need quote for grandson - i will be retiring soon and will have medicare. he is currently insured under my insurance thru work will need individual policy for grandson - i am his guardian', 'Searching for affordable health insurace, i need to save money so i am cutting down costs everywhere', 'I am confused. just looking for an insurance company. dont know what is best. i am cancer free now but want a company that is accepted by sloan kettering. dont know if my answers are correct. need to speak with someone. i gave 5 stars for all but really have no clue', 'Great company, i have been very happy with united health care', 'Canceled pcp , canceled ochsner in our state as a health care provider after they couldnt agree on a contract. this is the only real healthcare option in our area and has been for a while. this is after only 4 months being with them. no warning , nothing. seems disingenuous at best, fraudulent at worst. why didnt they tell us this was a liklihood before signing us up.', 'Horrible, lost premium for a whole month!, lost our first payment for a whole month. offered to move effective date to feb 1st which i dont want', 'Truly awful at handling wrong claims, i have spent so many hours on chat and on the phone with over 7 different people who seemingly cant understand my problem. ive had to explain it so many different times. ill give you a couple examples. today (the final straw), i finally got through to a supervisor who understood my issue - that the bill i received from my doctor was billed as medical, not preventative. the uhc employee said theyd handle it. they called the doctor, and when the doctor said it was medical, they *just accepted the doctors word for it*. they didnt try to argue my case (that it was my annual physical, it was obviously preventative). they just said oh okay and called me. when i said they were wrong, they acted all surprised even though i had *just explained this to them on the phone*. other times i have completely explained my problem in chat, with dates and bill amounts, only fifteen seconds later to have my chat representative ask for the dates and bill amounts. its like no one is listening at all. i had to end up paying the claim because it had been four months and was about to start hitting my credit score.', 'Retiree insurance running out, i need some short term insurance to do me until my medicare starts from march until june or july', 'I want to remain with united health care, i want to stay but the plan is ending. call me. 301-775-4632. i live in maryland', 'Worst ever, this company is one of the worst insurance companies i have ever dealt with. i cannot believe how they treat their customers!', 'Very disapppointed., i have had united healthcare for at least14 years through my employer and have been very satisfied with my health care coverage until now. i have sought treatment for alcohol dependence through an intensive outpatient program to get sober and save my life and my family. i am in my 8th week of a ten week program and have been sober for 30 days and feel the best i have felt in years. last week i was told by my treatment program director that united healthcare has only approved 19 sessions of a 30 session program and they felt that this program was just like an inpatient program and they wouldnt approve more than 19 sessions. my program director said that this is common with united healthcare and they often deny full coverage for substance abuse recovery programs. i had to already pay $640.00 out of my own pocket for this program to meet my out of pocket maximum and i dont know how im going to be able to pay for the 11 remaining sessions. this is very frustrating i have always felt that i had the best health insurance around that cared about its customers. but in this instance they clearly do not. they pay to get my started and well into my treatment than they say sorry we will not cover you for the remainder of your treatment that in my case if very important for my well being. i guess they only care about making money off me not fulfilling their responsibility to cover me for treatment i so greatly need. im so disappointed in you united healthcare.', 'They donot accept many prescription drug medicines, they would not cover my asthma mefication. they only provide one medication that may be ok for me. i will not be keeping them after this year.', 'Uhc has highest premiums but pays next to nothing., surgery: uhc did not pay anesthesiologist-we checked and double checked that we were getting in-network facilities and doctors. one anesthesiologist had to cover for another unbeknownst to me (i was under) - uhc refused to pay. uhc also did not pay my mammogram radiologist. our premiums tripled this year; we have doctors and hospitals that were dropped by uhc in january, so we have to pay out of pocket to them. uhcs ceo made record profits this year because this is how they treat their members: charge them outrageous premiums, refuse to pay when members need to use their insurance; drop hospitals, facilities, and doctors mid-year so members are forced to pay uhc and pay out-of-pocket to doctors. uhc is unethical; they force you to hold their insurance a year, yet they drop your doctors and hospitals soon after your contract begins. they do not honor your contracts-if there is another insurance option for you, choose the other option.', 'Worst claim service ever, my policy states i have no maximum number of visits for chiropractic care, but then they deny claims stating ive exceeded my maximum number of visits. i filed an appeal only to receive a denial response that says my appeal was not an appeal. what an incompetent company. policy clearly states coverages and they come back and deny coverage. call customer service and they tell me there is no one i can talk to about this i can only send a letter. this has been going on for 4 months and yet i cant talk to anyone about it, they refuse to let me talk to anyone when i ask to talk to someone who can help me. complete incompetence.', 'Suck, impossible to get a hold of the right person, company is a joke have to make sure they bill it and not denied', 'Difficult to use, just incredibly difficult to get any help if you need it. their call my empleyer to tell them to put me to work with restriction,doctor gived me 6 weeks and united healthcare wanted me to come back to work 2 weeks after i had my surgery so they dont have to pay me anything wish is not fare for me been paying this insurance for 5 years and when i need it dont get anything,i just come back to work and still waiting have to go with doctor to get a note to come back at early time couse my bills and stuff was on top of my haed already.', 'Horrible, the claim process is archaic. long waits on phone calls then get bounced around without getting questions answered. they do not respond to emails and are the epitome of customer no service.', 'Worst insurance ever, company stinks - canceled my insurance with no warning and kept on accepting my premiums for months without telling me my insurance was canceled! what a bunch of crooks! warn everyone you know!', 'Avoid like the plague!!!!! beware, worst company in every way. they sure know how to collect premiums but provide no service whatsoever. nowhere to get a script for my daughter filled in the entire state of michigan???? on the phone for literally 8 and one half hours and no results.', 'Billing is so slow, your billing process is so slow. the web portal is horrible for companies trying to print out bill, it will rarely let me on. i have to call the number almost every time.', 'Good, nothing bad to say about it except it has been good insurance. out of work now and need new insurance. looking for new insurance due to unemployment', 'Railroad insurance, my husband worked for the railroad for 40 years with this insurance. it was wonderful. now hes disabled and my insurance runs out dec. 31, 2014.', 'My insurance, insurance i had received was adequit but is now going out of my medicare just need a suplimental', 'Very good, simply, i like the coverage i have with this company.', 'Good, want to retire i am 62 years old cant get medicare to 65 years old got to add my wife to plan.', 'Wonderful , excellent.', 'Okay, i received it thru work, now on cobra,which will expire soon, i had no real problems except last 2 years have a deductable then only pay 80 percent', 'Employer provided insurance.', 'It was insurance provide by my college that is no longer avaliable', 'Please note that i am on temporary disability and will be not be returning to work after the 6 months is up in march 2015 as i have just applied for ssdi.', 'Cobra expiring, my cobra insurance with this company will expire at the end of november 2014. i need to get new insurance for medical, pharmacy, and dental.', 'Great service/rising costs, i have been pleased with united health care which is offered by my employer. however, my rates will increase about $200 to cover my two children. i cant afford the increase.', 'Denial of needed medical service, united healthcare denied a program that i need in acute rehabilitation. i am told by the facility that they are the only insurance company denying this same request. have left me to suffer pain and immobility. ignoring rheumatogist and physical therapists.', 'United health is very reliable., i do not have to have any referrals to see any doctor/specialist. i have no co-payments at any doctors office. very helpful with any problems which is usually something that i dont understand. i have a registered nurse who contacts me every 2-3 weeks to find out how i am doing, changes in meds, any new health problems. the nurse is very helpful and informative. my only problem is the high cost, but i guess its goes back to the saying you get what you pay for.', 'Worst insurance company ive ever had to deal with, september 2017 this policy was chosen by my husbands employer and is the worst company ive ever had to work with. we have been with them for a little over two years. they have paid one claim to each of two doctors i have seen during this entire time. ive called, the doctors billing departments have called and they refuse to help. every claim has been denied and they refuse to pay and none of can ever speak to anyone that can/ will help us understand what they need or why theyre of paying. they keep saying they need full medical records and they have been sent repeatedly and denied repeatedly. yesterday i received a call from my doctor office and they are now refusing further medical care. i have a chronic health condition for which i am required to see the doctor once a month and they cannot by law treat or prescribe my medication without seeing me. at this point i am unsure what i am going to do. this may possibly be a situation that ends my life. my doctor is going to turn it over to their attorney but i could be dead before they get a resolution. if you have ability to choose your insurance provider please make certain you choose another company', 'Overall pretty good in all ares, if my company was not closing i would stay with the health plan.', 'United healthcare covered my docotors appointments, unitedcare did cover all my doctors appointments. my bloodwork & my port being flushed. it also covered my petscan that i needed to have.', '13, would like something cheaper than 170.00 a month', 'Thet have given excellent coverage, united healthcare has always been there for me giving me excellent coverage in times that i needed it. their deductbles are very reasonable and their
