IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas City
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue cross blue sheld more then doubled their rates, and offer the worst insurance coverage ever, their deductables are high, out of pocket high, why have insurance when you pay for everything yourself. their $600.00 a month policy is now $1,700.00 a month. sham sham', 'Isitusal, i took the best policy offered by my employer because i am a cancer survivor and testing is expensive. i also am being treated for depression and the meds i am prescribed are very expensive. however, the cost of just under $105.00 per week is to hard to keep up with along with my co-pays.', 'Ive learned i should pay a little more out of poc, im still seeking insurance that fits my budget.this company has good coverage but am paying a higher premium than i need because i dont have serious health conditions.', 'I always thought this was the best, but the monthly premiums are expensive and now that i am on senior care it seems to cover less than it once did.', 'Decent coverage but controlling, they switched my medication without going through my doctor due to it being cheaper for them. the new medication is not as effective and they declined my switch back to the old medication. currently appealing it.', 'Service sucks!!, i have been having some troubles with ordering prescriptions. the pharmacist wants to charge me 400 bucks after my deductible has been made. i have contacted bcbs several times and nothing has been done. they told me they would have it fixed yesterday, but no one called back. i left 3 messages yesterday with the case manager. can you help? any suggestions? case manager: bonita valles 401-459-5534 case number 4769-20mar17 so, as you can see, the case started on march 20th, but i actually called them a few days before that and they gave me an incomplete case number. i have psoriasis and it gets worse when i cant get my meds and if i get frustrated! well, i am frustrated. i am at the point where i need to get lawyers involved or go to channel 12 or 10.', 'Very costly', 'I detest this co but it is better than my last, clear your entire day if you need to get info from empire bc bs. it is very expensive insurance, you do not get to see the doctors you would like to see (hmo) and dealing with customer service is frustrating at best. you remain on hold forever and are transferred to three different people who put you on hold forever and it leaves such a bad taste in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 why did i have to pay one for 2016. the customer service representative had told me that it was a mistake on their part to charge me early. and that next month in jan i would only need to pay my 2016 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no does the hiring for this posistion, kudos to you! you couldnt ask for a better spokesperson for your company. she was people friendly and not at all the usual rhetoric of hey...lets get this done because i have quota to fill. she went out of her way to inform me and help me out in my situation. i realize everybodys case is differant, but once again.....so far, so good. what a good feeling after i hung. thanks deb.....you rock! your company probably wishes it had 1000 more like you.', 'Very satisfied, i found bc/bs to be reasonably priced and easy to work with. we had a substantial choice of doctors in our local area.', 'Amazing service, i would use this company in a heart beat.they are amazing', 'Bcbs of ma, company headquartered in ma - this was the best option in terms of which existing doctors accepted the bdbs coverage. they also have a very robust technology platform.', 'Good, a very good insurance plan that requires a downpayment for every visit of at least $25 and is very prompt in paying the med bills as well as billing the customer.', 'I do not have any idea what this is for!!!!!!!!!!!!', 'Very satisfied, very happy but im leaving my job.', 'I will be losing my husbands health insurance november', 'I have this with former employer. i got laid off. coverage ends today.', 'Interested in comparision, i am interested in getting a quote. currently my insurance is provided thru a retirement plan from verizon. i would like to see the cost if i were to purchase insurance without going thru verizon', 'Iam retireing the 21srt of nvember 2014, i will need a low cost health insurance my monthly income will be 15336.00 a year please help me find some insuranse', 'Wanting to price comparison', 'They suck, this insurance company used to be good,not so much anymore.they just want to receive money for little return.will cancel asap.', 'Horrible and worthless, my neurosurgeon arrived at the decision i needed surgery because i cannot feel my legs. it’s caused from a disc pinching nerves. twice he submitted for the surgery and was denied both times. each time he submitted doing it a different way to save money for them. even talked to them and expressed the urgency of the surgery still denied. i have went through physical therapy and i had one steroid injection which i had allergic reaction to and nearly ended my life. my doctor has all the test showing surgery is only option to get me back on my feet. nothing else helps. insurance doesn’t care they say no. i’m 35 and stuck in a bed and in pain constantly. i’m missing out on my children’s lives because i cannot function. i was forced to get this insurance because it was my only option . i pay triple what i paid through my job for this worthless insurance and they won’t do what my doctors see as medical necessary. my doctor has gotten so mad and red faced saying himself they don’t care about the patients they only care about their money. what’s the point in having and paying for something that doesn’t care about your well being or giving you the coverage you’re paying for. they are worthless, heartless, and a crooked company. don’t waste your time or your money on this insurance they will not help you when you need it no matter the circumstances.', 'Horrible health ins, fep bc bs basic plan, this is doesnt cover squat for prescriptions, they need prior authorizations for scripts so often ive never had worse company, they have a hidden deductible thats called something else in order to fool you. i cant wait to be done with it', 'It sucks , pay doctor 160 they say owe 190 and apply 102 to deductible. they deny medications. they aren’t helpful with customer service. they are worst insurance ever', 'So terrible, the stuff they put me through has to be illegal. they lie and dont cover anything they say they will', 'Customer service gave bad information, customer service on a recorded line tells me 1 pair of glasses with no restrictions on options would be covered by my policy after cataract surgery. claim was denied. appeal was denied. my last letter says too much time has elapsed since the initial denial decision.', 'Denied, i knew my insurance was ending. i called a bcbs rep. to make sure i would still be covered for my appointment on such date. she told me yes up until midnight that night. well, she was wrong! now i have a bill sitting here. im wrong for trusting her i guess!! so my suggestion is to: call 2 or 3 times to make sure you get the same answer from all 3 reps. bcbs hire someone who knows their job!! who can you trust!!', 'Could not be happier, never doubted our insurance, but after a recent miss communication with an urgent care, i couldnt be happier with our customer service. i felt heard, supported and trusted the issue was being resolved. thank you so much for caring for your customers as people and not just numbers!', 'Very happy with company, this policy is a cobra policy from my employer and it bcbsga is saving my life everyday!!! customer service is always very nice and helpful, i have been using them since the market place opened, however the coverage is less and more expensive for 2017. we hope to stay with them!! i have a rare disease and alot of medical issues, but bcbsga has been there for me in the past three years. alot of people complain about this company...i guess i got very lucky!!! i understand that they need to raise the coverage prices i just hope we can afford it!!!! its one thing to just exsit in life another thing to live life and so far they have helped me live life....i truly hope that doesnt change!!! thank you bcbsga helping me everyday to live life instead of just existing!!! you guys and gals are my heros !!!!!!!!!!', 'I like blue cross blue shield, i ['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

['Supplement to medicare, i am disabled and get ssdi. i can only work 15 hours a week. last year my total income for the year 2014 was $2,000. i need to get cheaper health insurance for my two boys. blue cross blue shield monthly premiums are terrible and so is the coverage', 'My time with humana, in my time with humana, have had a few serious trips to the hospital and they covered most of the costs. plus they cover doctor visits with only a $10.00 co-pay. when i have to call every one is polite and very helpful.', 'Humana, it is a great company i am already insured with them already. thank you anyway.i have health isurance with them but would like to have for child health insurance if i can get it cheap.', 'Incompetent , rude, ineffectual, unskilled group, if at all possible do not use this company. rather than give a list of all the things they cant do let me give a list of the only thing they can. they will take your money and refuse to pay for most if not all the health claims you submit. if i had the time and money i would start a class action suit who knows maybe after my wife dies because she cant get the treat she needs i will. this company really needs to pay or at the very least be destroyed.', 'Dont use humana!, if you live in vancouver wa, dont sign up for humana! they do not have any primary care physicians in this area so now im stuck without health care for the year and cant transfer to another plan!', 'Request validation of need for additional insuranc, i am retired from the university of california, and am and air force retiree. i have tricare for life and i have supplemental insurance through the university, at the same time i am on medicare. my question is do i need the additional supplemental health insurance recommended by tricare?', 'I find it probing, i may not be seeing this in the proper way but it seams geared at selling me insurance which i cant afford.', 'There a scam. , i did not see anywhere it said i was locked in for a year with them. but now we are stuck being robbed for a year. please please dont loose your money on this scam its a joke. no one is in there network and the ones that are. say they are dropping them as fast as they can. please save your self from this theft.', 'They will do whatever it takes to keep from paying, humana will do whatever it takes to keep from paying a medical claim, no matter what medical documentation is supplied to support the claim. the only thing they care about is money.', 'Great coveragethey have great costumer service, they have great service at a low cost i like the coverage. i wish they still had service in my area.', 'Good, it told me what i needed to know in an understandable way. it asked the right questions at the right times.', 'Medical comparison and need dental, im inquiring about other medical insurance coverage for the sake of comparison. i dont have dental coverage and would like quotes on those available.', 'Great insurance company, humana one is a pretty good insurance company. i have been with humana now for about four years with out any difficulties ; however,for the past couple of years the rate has gone up extraordinarily', 'Not sure y humana told me i had 2 find new insur, ive been happy with humana. they told me i had to find new insurance, which i still dont understand why.', 'George toth, the insurance has been great but im currently shopping for new rates.', 'New plan costs toooo much', 'Payment of claim, good response with explanation and payment of insurance for services.', 'Good company, they are a good company but there over all cost are to hi. alot prescription drugs are not listed, that i would be taken if it was not for the costs. copays: should not have any co pays for the price i pay monthly for medical and drugs.all company costs are way out of line.', 'Cost, i want to find out if i can my daughter,who is 13 years old', 'Affordable care act forcing change, affordable care act is forcing a change in my coverage (against my wishes)', 'Better policy, better price', 'Policy is too expesive, my wife has the cost of my insurance deducted from her retirement chack and the increase will be taking 40% of her monthly checkin 2014.', 'Company provided,']

IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Montana
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of NC
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of North Dakota
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other ['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']

['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']
['We would have continued with this company but have to purchase new insurance under the new OBMA CARE issue that is now the OBMA LAW.']

IssuerName: Harvard Pilgrim Health Care of NE
Reviews: ['They have the best customer service. Since day one all my issues have been handled appropriately and immediately. Not only do they call for an update but they also follow-up with a letter. Kudos to Mr. Joseph Tierney of the Appeals Dept. thank you so much for your help.']

Disgusting service! things happen for a reason and I rather have no insurance or another company than dealing with this people. oh to sum up Im already 40 minutes on hold 20 and I got the representative back stating that the managers are in a meeting and not available to talk to me.']

IssuerName: AmeriHealth Ins Company of New Jersey
Reviews: ['Our house burned down in the Valley Fire in Lake County, CA on 9/12/15. Chubb responded immediately and was there in every area of support - we had a direct cell number to reach our claims adjuster and a direct email address to contact him. (With State Farm who insured our business there was no direct cell number or email, all contact went through a convoluted phone system and you had to wait days until someone returned your call and they were never the same person).']
['Agent contact,', 'tried to call my agent broker, and get a message saying mailbox is full and cannot get in contact with him at the Freehold Office.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Mexico
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a IssuerName: Molina Health Care of New Mexico, Inc.
Reviews: ['I have held an American National life insurance policy for years. Their web site is like something from the very earliest days of the internet. Its horrible to navigate and paying your bill online is virtually impossible. It never recognizes my username and password and the policy number ON MY DOCUMENTATION from American National is NEVER recognized on their site. So I called several times to pay my premium and couldnt hold any longer on all calls (held for more than 30 minutes on each). Finally MAILED a check still in good time. Took them WEEKS to cash the check but finally they did. Then they sent me a letter telling me that my insurance was canceled pending reinstatement. I called again hoping to reinstate over the phone and held for 47 minutes. When I finally got through I was told reinstatement couldnt be done over the phone but once they received my forms I should (hopefully) be reinstated within a MONTH. Thanks for NOTHING. They should get their money back from their web designer except he/she probably got paid in 1994 for their work and no updates have been done since then.']
['New Mexico Health Connections is not real insurance']

['We were involuntarily placed by Washington state Medicaid with Amerigroup without notice. We had been with Molina for many years, and were shocked to find that Amerigroup was involved now. I have a severely disabled daughter. I was very disturbed to find out that Amerigroup did not pay for a therapy provider that my daughter had been covered for almost five years through other Medicaid managed care plans. We do get to change back to Molina effective the first of next month, which does cover this therapist and many other useful providers. I also found that Amerigroup has very few general practice providers either. The pediatric clinic where my daughter has been going (with other Medicaid managed care plans) for nearly 14 years, isnt covered by Amerigroup either. I have looked on the internet since finding out about Amerigroup, and see that plenty of other people report having crappy experiences with them as well. If you have ANY other choice for a Medicaid plan, you should probably reject Amerigroup and chose another provider. I am in Washington, and it appears that Amerigroup handles everything out of Virginia. You will probably do much better with a Medicaid plan like Molina, which has MANY years of successful work in Washington (and many other states) and at least has a local office in Washington (and probably in all or most of the other states that they serve as well).']

IssuerName: HMO Colorado, Inc., dba HMO Nevada
Reviews: ['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

['Progressive one top company,', 'excellent service, speedy, Careing,Professional,Clean facilities, good coffee while you wait with witty conversation I Did not have to wait long n got a rental car free, plus a tank of gasn fresh cookies with that coffee too']

IssuerName: Rocky Mountain Hospital and Medical Service, Inc., dba Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield
Reviews: ['I was entrusted by Geico insurance to this carrier. I had to file a claim with this company due to the severe weather that North Texas has been hit with over the last several months. I have been fighting with them for over a month in order for them to come and fix my home. They dont seem to be in any hurry to fix the issues (water is pouring into my house). It seems like the longer I wait the more damage that its going to cause to my house. I have conveyed that to them and the people set in place to help, dont give a rats ass about you. There attitude is so non caring that it makes you feel like you are begging. DO NOT GET INSURE BY THIS COMPANY. I have gone as far as contacting the CEO through linkedin to see if I get any sort of response from them. I am not holding my breath for one. I think that they think that if they ignore me long enough that i will go away. They messed with the wrong guy. I would rather spend the money on an attorney before I feel like I got taken advantage by them.']

['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the IssuerName: Medical Health Insuring Corp. of Ohio
Reviews: ['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']
['One word to describe the customer service and general insurance provided by Molina is RUN!!! If you are unfortunate enough to select them be aware of several things:']

['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

['Our house burned down in the Valley Fire in Lake County, CA on 9/12/15. Chubb responded immediately and was there in every area of support - we had a direct cell number to reach our claims adjuster and a direct email address to contact him. (With State Farm who insured our business there was no direct cell number or email, all contact went through a convoluted phone system and you had to wait days until someone returned your call and they were never the same person).']

IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Oklahoma
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat ['I have a chronic/terminal illness which is survivable with treatment. This is why I pay anywhere between $250-$500 for my premiums (mine alone) per month. This is easily the worst coverage I have ever had.']

IssuerName: Kaiser Foundation Healthplan of the NW
Reviews: ['After being on Kaiser from the age of six months to now at 58 and never having a problem, all that has changed. In the last few years the rates have gone up and up and service has gotten worse. Its all about the money. I have a chronic, painful condition- arthritis in my neck (diagnosed by a Kaiser Dr.) and TMJ. I have had an RX for a pain med and muscle relaxer for years, which was used only as needed and sparingly. I was sent a notice recently that they had assigned me a new Dr. after years of seeing the old one who never gave me a problem with refills. I recently sent in a refill request for my meds and the request was denied saying I had to come in for lab tests and an evaluation to determine if I actually had the condition and or if it still existed What??? NO! Im not stupid and know Arthritis and TMJ do not resolve. They are permanant conditions and lab tests etc. are NOT necessary for these conditions. They only want me to come in and pay the MUCH higher than before co-pays to run tests that are not necessary and are worthless as far as my conditions. They kept me going through tons of red tape and hearings I didnt request only to keep denying me my meds. NO more Kaiser for us. We are leaving and going to a new health plan. Kaiser is no longer the good company it once was. Now its corporate greed.']

['Innovation Health in general is awful. The ONLY thing they are good at is figuring out how NOT to pay for services. They think using jazzy language and having bubbly graphics on their website makes them an effective insurance company, but they are wrong. Dont get sick out of state. They wont pay for any of it. Dont go to the ER out of state. They wont pay for it. Even if a hospital has Aetna, dont be fooled: if the hospital does not specifically say Innovation Health/Aetna, then they wont cover you. You have to live your entire life in Northern Virginia, or they wont cover you. (Or live in a bubble if you travel.) Dont even get sick past Mary Washington Hospital in Fburg. They wont cover you. Their deductibles are a little much for individuals. And when they negotiate a rate, they will only apply the negotiated rate to your deductible whether or not the hospital accepts it. (Say, for example, the hospital charges me 1,000 dollars for a procedure, and Innovation health assumes a negotiated rate will be 650, but you get a bill for 1,000, anyway. Innovation Health will only apply the 650 to your deductible, because, in their magical, pretend world, that is what they believe is fair. This is way, way too much bull for a plan. When enrollment is open again, I am getting out of this bs plan pronto.']

side, sending shards of glass everywhere. the driver of that monstrosity did not have the standard signs out to deter any vehicles from coming to the space they would need to make such a turn, and the only witnesses to this action were apparently a co-worker in the truck with him, and my passenger. as we telephoned the authorities, mr. lewis stated that the accident would be rectified. we have him stating this on tape and video. after sending all information required for a claim (photos, etc.) and with their representative finally showing up three (3) weeks after the incident, a caitlin carroll-weisser (caitlin.carroll@thehartford.com) stated that they are not liable for repairs or damage, because they had spoken to the witnesses, which they had not. even while their appraiser - byron evans was viewing my vehicle at my home, he stated that our claim had been discarded by the initial claims taker, because that claims taker had somewhere else to go that week in preparation for his vacation. he stated that he had no idea why that appraiser had ignored our claim. he stated that he also didnt know how he ended up with our case. hartford refused to pay for the damages. their actions were straight up callous, and racist. until they do, we will continue to share this story with every entity on and off the internet, within every media source in every state, and eventually in the court of law.', 'They dont pay claims, theyll take your money but screw you when you make a claim. hartford approved an estimate on my wifes car, then refused to pay half of it after the work was done, claiming the damage was from a different accident. it wasnt. we are getting our lawyer involved.', 'Good but costly, good company. insured with hartford for 3 years. rates increased dramatically this year 2017. cancelled policies and went with liberty mutual. big mistake!! got our new policy after paying in full and received less coverage and different type than what we agreed to pay for. liberty would make no adjustments to give is what we were told unless we paid more for the policy. would have been $300 more than what hartford was charging us and less coverage. went back to harrford. they reinstated old policies 3 weeks after cancelling with them and didnt charge us a penny more. great service! but still expensive!', 'Fraudulent! hartford yrs padding odometer readings, review is 1 for everything unless current problem gets resolved. was happy (but never had a claim) w/ customer service until today, when...fraudulent! hartford padding odometer readings, for years! important to read this! i just found out hartford had been padding (increased by at least 1,000 miles a year) my 3 odometer readings for the last 2 years (and likely for the whole 8 yrs ive been a customer). trying to get them to tell me (and email me for documented proof) all the odometer readings they have for me being a customer since 2009 but getting a total run-around, them saying they dont keep that info. really? um, i dont think so. for legal reasons they have to have this, especially if youre a current customer. i may be looking into subpeoning them for this info via an attorney & may have lawsuit thatll effect all their customers (ask them for your odometer readings for past years up to current). i thought hartford was the rare decent insurance company but now i have doubts. no one will give me anyone with enough real company authority to speak to, only a rep who is at a call center! very disappointed & disgusted!', 'Good company, hartford is a good company.they were
