['I have held an American National life insurance policy for years. Their web site is like something from the very earliest days of the internet. Its horrible to navigate and paying your bill online is virtually impossible. It never recognizes my username and password and the policy number ON MY DOCUMENTATION from American National is NEVER recognized on their site. So I called several times to pay my premium and couldnt hold any longer on all calls (held for more than 30 minutes on each). Finally MAILED a check still in good time. Took them WEEKS to cash the check but finally they did. Then they sent me a letter telling me that my insurance was canceled pending reinstatement. I called again hoping to reinstate over the phone and held for 47 minutes. When I finally got through I was told reinstatement couldnt be done over the phone but once they received my forms I should (hopefully) be reinstated within a MONTH. Thanks for NOTHING. They should get their money back from their web designer except he/she probably got paid in 1994 for their work and no updates have been done since then.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of South Carolina
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue cross blue sheld more then doubled their rates, and offer the worst insurance coverage ever, their deductables are high, out of pocket high, why have insurance when you pay for everything yourself. their $600.00 a month policy is now $1,700.00 a month. sham sham', 'Isitusal, i took the best policy offered by my employer because i am a cancer survivor and testing is expensive. i also am being treated for depression and the meds i am prescribed are very expensive. however, the cost of just under $105.00 per week is to hard to keep up with along with my co-pays.', 'Ive learned i should pay a little more out of poc, im still seeking insurance that fits my budget.this company has good coverage but am paying a higher premium than i need because i dont have serious health conditions.', 'I always thought this was the best, but the monthly premiums are expensive and now that i am on senior care it seems to cover less than it once did.', 'Decent coverage but controlling, they switched my medication without going through my doctor due to it being cheaper for them. the new medication is not as effective and they declined my switch back to the old medication. currently appealing it.', 'Service sucks!!, i have been having some troubles with ordering prescriptions. the pharmacist wants to charge me 400 bucks after my deductible has been made. i have contacted bcbs several times and nothing has been done. they told me they would have it fixed yesterday, but no one called back. i left 3 messages yesterday with the case manager. can you help? any suggestions? case manager: bonita valles 401-459-5534 case number 4769-20mar17 so, as you can see, the case started on march 20th, but i actually called them a few days before that and they gave me an incomplete case number. i have psoriasis and it gets worse when i cant get my meds and if i get frustrated! well, i am frustrated. i am at the point where i need to get lawyers involved or go to channel 12 or 10.', 'Very costly', 'I detest this co but it is better than my last, clear your entire day if you need to get info from empire bc bs. it is very expensive insurance, you do not get to see the doctors you would like to see (hmo) and dealing with customer service is frustrating at best. you remain on hold forever and are transferred to three different people who put you on hold forever and it leaves such a bad taste in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 why did i have to pay one for 2016. the customer service representative had told me that it was a mistake on their part to charge me early. and that next month in jan i would only need to pay my 2016 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no emails/mail! now, just got off the phone with another representative, a male this time. i saw that my payments this month were still for the new 2017, so i called to see why. the representative this time was unhelpful, he was confused most of the time, kept repeating the same information to me even after i told him several times that what he was telling me had nothing to do with my questions. it was stressful. the guy told me in the most round-about-way why i must pay my 2017 premium this month, and repeatedly kept avoiding my concerns. according to the new representative, the other representative i talked to (the lady) was wrong! you pay a month in advance. i am new to insurances, so this may be the correct, maybe this guy lied, i dont know. but someone lied to me. and i wanted someone to look into my conversation with the lady. i asked him if blue shield records conversations, he said yes after several attempts to avoid this question. but here is the best part, my previous conversation with the lady was not recorded. how convenient. he said he looked it up and doesn’t see a recording. she didn’t log in her location at the time. they cant trace the call without that or without a confirmation number which she never gave me. this played out too conveniently and is disgusting how they dealt with it. its about more than saving a few dollars now. at this point this is all about whats right and this is not', 'Wish there was a zero star, my brother was in a horrible car accident had 7 surgeries and now he is in rehab hospital dr recommended at least a month in rehab, after 5 days of rehab blue cross said he is ok to go home after there retarded dr mckinsey read his medical records , stupid dr it is obvious you never went to med school my brother can not walk or turn on his own he has tubes hanging out of his stomach, he can barely move 7 surgeries stupid dr mckinsey a 5 year old could have looked at his medical records and understand that he is not walikng or moving,i will make sure every news station gets ahold of this, you sure are good collecting your payments', 'Insurance through employment benefits, had bcbs for past 35 years. now that retired and carry this coverage.', 'Blue shield special care, i love having special care because i dont earn enough to afford anything else. now that the affordable care act is coming in to play, i am losing special care which covered my hystorectomy 100%. i just hope i can find something very similar with no deductable and let me keep my family doctor', 'My insurance company, i was very happy with bcbs but they use to take my excellent health status into consideration. now they do not and my monthly bill will be going up 178%. i cant afford to stay on this plan with that amount per month. i have only been to the hospital once in my life and that was for a ruptured appendix and take one generic medication. otherwise, i am very healthy,and i hate to say this, for my age. they have been very good whenever i have had a question or concern, but the cost is too much as i am unemployed at the moment. i have been going to a gym for 34 years and eat right. i rarely see the doctor and i only see one these days for preventative medicine procedures. i find it sad that i have done everything right in my life and now i have to pay more for it. i probably will not be staying with bcbs because of the cost.', 'Need health coverage, turning age 26 years of age on december 11. 2013 and will no longer have coverage under my mothers health insurance policy. i need some kind of coverage before i am aged out of her health policy with her employer.', 'Lack of support, i have a visa interview at the french embassy on 18th of may. today is 11th of may. the embassy requires a letter from the insurance company confirming that my policy covers emergencies while in france. i called the customer service. the guy confirmed that the letter will be sent to me by mail and will take at least 7 to 10 business days!!! - i asked if theres any way i can get it before 18th (the interview date)? * no. sorry. - can i pay the cost of faster mailing system that can guarantee the letter delivering before the 18th? * no. sorry. - can the letter be sent to me by email? since you say it is now ready? * no. sorry. - can anyone take a picture or scan and text that letter to me for my urgent need to it? * no. sorry. - well. my entire travel plan is dependent on the visa, and the visa is dependent on a letter from you. my travel plan might be messed up due to your slow ten business days mailing system, and you still insist not to send this letter via email??!! are you telling me that i have to purchase a new travel insurance policy to be on the safe side? * yes. sorry. omg.... wtf???!!! how professional is that? how respectful to the customer? im not blaming the customer support guy. but the company stupid policy. if this letter meant to be sent to me? why the hell it cannot be e-mailed to me (especially for such matters)??!!!', 'Beware all this is junk insurance, i purchased blue cross blue shield anthem pathway as a private plan ive been on this plan a month now for the last three listed in there directory when i try to make an appointment i ask if they take blue cross pathway they all say they do but will not touch anything blue cross pathway on it some of the listed drs offices stated that this is a thrash plan they write everything off and do not pay therefore we chose not to accept it i call blue cross back for help and after many hours of no help and rudeness they partial disability payment for a total of $3250 per month, and i have expenses other than insurance! my premium is $2155.33 per month plus multiple meds + mortgage payment + food + utilities + etc. i have been notified that my monthly premium will soon increase to $2855.81. thank you for your assistance---please e-mail me any options i may have through bcbs (i need them because all of the counting the deductible of $6500 hundred. crazy!', 'Choose another provider , yes my premium goes up coverage is basically non existent. thanks for the waisted time and money. claims have been denied over and over for basic dr. appts', 'Insured through husbands employer, adequate insurance coverage, but cost quite high and getting higher. not all needed drugs are on their formulary here in minnesota, which gets cost prohibitive also.', 'Prescription coverage confusion, during 2012 and 2013 i had bc/bs plan-65 blue select c, with a premium of about $150-!60 per mo. and the pdp plan than was an option for an addl cost. these were medicare add-on plans. for 2014 i switched to the bluechip $0 $0 $0 plan. little did i know that during 2012+13 blue cross was picking up a $365 monthly co-pay for my immuno-surpressant meds. before choosing the bluechip $0 0 0 plan i carefully examined every monthly pdp summary and every other summary i received and did not find anywhere that showed the $365 copay being paid. i believed that nedicare part b was covering the immumnosurpressants, which they do in fact cover, but only 80%. so, back in january of 2014, i go to retrive my meds (that cost me 0 for the past 2 years) and the pharmacy asks me for $365.i was stunned! what $365 ? where did this come from? i never saw anything that showed me that this even existed, and certainly nothing showing that this amount was paid by any insurer. i am told that this is the 20% copay that bc/bs was covering in 2012+13. well now if this ($365) is the 20% copay i would expect the total cost to be about $1825. it is not. to make things more confusing...somehow 2 prescriptions costing about $1200 have a 20% copay of $365. must be medical math? luckily for me a very nice transplant coordinator at ['I was injured severely in Arizona and cat travel to SD for medical care. Out of network ACCIDENT coverage is $5,000. Co-payment is 40%- 60% I pay the 60% of an unlimited amount. My subsidized premium is $14,000 (est.). I didnt choose the accident, it chose me. Do the math, WHO WOULD BY SUCH A PLAN? The AHCA NAVIGATOR (Doug) says this was the best plan for traveling outside Averas network through the PHCS/MULTIPLANE network recognized nationwide. He or Avera are wrong. Terrible SILVER plan, terrible company to transfer my health risk to, terrible staff to talk with. From denials to appeals Avera is TERRIBLE.']

['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

IssuerName: Cigna Health and Life Insurance Company
Reviews: ['Broke promises, wish i could give them 0 stars. they have lied and stalled and wasted so much of my time. i was told i would be refunded through submitted a medical claim form. i was even told i would receive payment in 2 weeks! that was 6 months ago!', 'Great service , i really liked cigna, the only reason i left is because they couldnt cover me anymore due to my move out of state. i guess they just didnt have anyone out here. they are kind of expensive but what insurance isnt anymore? it was pretty much the best price i could find. but not bad guest service.', 'Annual price increase, i have had insurance for the past 40+ years, previously with my employer, but now im paying over $3,000 a quarter of $216,000 converage. the price is now rediculous, but at 71 years old how can i change???????', 'Cigna, i have been very happy with cigna, they have good coverage and are easy to get a hold of when i have questions. good dental coverage as well.', 'I would rather deal with the cable company, terrible customer service, glacial claims processing, a willingness to find any reason to deny, impossible to communicate with. in 30+ years of work, i have never dealt with a worse insurance provider. absolutely horrible.', 'False representation of benefits, needed an elective ultrasound for rule out of cancerous tumor. called cigna to ensure that my current insurance plan covers the procedure. cigna representative provided information that if i completed my procedure at the diagnostic center on the list provided and emailed to my attention, the procedure is covered 100% regardless of my deductible and all i am responsible only for the office copayment. then a month later after the procedure, i received a cigna statement stating that the ultrasound procedure is not covered 100% because i have not met the plan deductible. this is false representation of benefits by cigna. please beware of this insurance company. we just recently switch to cigna, and sadly to say that the poor reviews for this insurance company is true. cigna falsely represent their benefits to their customers especially when there is a non-routine procedure to be completed. do not recommend my experience with cigna has been a great one.', 'High premiums, cigna was our provider for 22 years. premiums went up outrageously the past two years.', 'Very helpful customer service, they had no problem spending time with you on the phone.teir rates were competitive for medicare supplement needs.', 'Cigna is employer picked plan, cigna is an employer selected plan for group health care plan benefit for its employees.', 'This was the cheapest option for group coverage offered by my company and that is why i went with connecticut general health insurance.', 'Good company, i like the effectiveness and customer service. it is the only insurance my company offered and it has served my family well... but now that we have an option to receive cheaper more cost efficient insurance for our family we are looking into our options.', 'My health, i loved this insurance it was the only one i had. i got it through work. but now with the presidents insurance plan i am loosing the one i like. it only cost me $100-$125 a month and was taken out of my check. now his plan is going to cost me over $300 a month. now i have to look for the affordable health care he promised.', 'Company provided coverage, its the best coverage they have had yet and wish they could pay a little extra to make it easier on me with my regular bills', 'Great, good phone service and coverage is decent', 'Not sure just what you want. is it cigna?', 'Employer based coverage, employer based coverage. switched jobs. need new insurance', 'Provided through work, i want to purchase insurance for my grankids', 'This insurance was provided by my employer', 'Good, insurance offered through husbands work. no complaints, but now looking at alternatives for myself alone. customer service has always been great. good solid company.', 'I am presently covered under my fathers insurance. i will be turning 26 years old and will no longer be covered', 'Coverage terminating 11/30/2016, after i was laid off in early 2015 the package they gave me had insurance coverage up t0 11/302016', 'My cobra ends dec 31, 20016, i am 64 and searching for individual health insurance that is affordable as i am currently unemployed.', 'B v,, hvfhgc', 'Was the company plan, good coverage company plan', 'Employer coverage, looking at options beyond just through employer', 'On cobra for 18 months after let go at my job of 23plus years due to disability. have had cigna for all the time i have been employed they do not cover nh otherwise i would like to stay with them.', 'Company provided through mother', 'Would love to keep this company, retiring, need coverage i can afford, not sure but i may be keeping cigna', 'Good hdhp plan at a reasonable cost, i am really pleased with cigna and would an individual plan that is similar. the provider network coverage is great.', 'Good, over all was a good deal with a very easy application. customer service was very friendly and i look forward to working with them again.', 'Good, good insurance co. i like it', 'Good, on cobra , expensive but good', 'Cigna health, i was insured with cigna via my company. in january i was laid off and the cost for cigna is extremely high.', 'Annual mammograms, will not cover annual mammograms we have paid for al mammograms cost for 3 years..they will not help on the phone and never can understand english', 'Coverage was good, most doctor offices accepted the plan.', 'Most of the time they are good to work with., for the most part we have been happy with cigna. one instance, a not helpful rep, left us fighting to have a large bill covered. other than that they have been ok!', 'Great insurance company, cigna is an amazing insurance company. they cover almost everything. their customer service department is the best and never any long wait time.', 'Bad office experiance, referrals are given to patients we go to thhe doctor only to find out later that the doctor or facility they send you to is not coverd and we end up with a very big bill no one knows anything ,front office staff is not very friendy,,when your sick they refuse to see you and always want you to go to urgent care that cost alot.', 'On cobra and its done july 2015, i was part of lay off and cigna was offerd as cobra', 'My mothers insurance--it was fine., i was on cigna through my mother for a few years while i was in school. it covered most of what i needed done. but im 26 this year so im off it and i need my own in case i get sick.', 'Accepted widely, cigna is accepted widely. limits are reasonable but copays are high.', 'Ok with cigna, currently on cobra', 'Lost job - paying cobra prices, i have cigna cobra - very expensive and lost job so looking for insurance', 'Was on my parents insurance which ends on 01/31/2015', 'Cigna was the insurance company that the company i work for was contracted with, as we are a self insured company, they also had something to do with greatwestern.', 'Cigna, this is the insurance they give you', 'Cigna is good insurance company, cigna is offered by my employeer over thel ast 10 plus years i ahve been very satisfied. overall i would recommend cigna!', 'Excellent insurance.', 'Coverage was through my significant others employer. great service and coverage, but employer is no loner offering coverage with cigna.', 'Thet were ok, lost the coverage due to my IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other insurance was asking why was the claims put in march 2nd. so this whole time they were lying to me saying it was put in. when on record it was put in last week.', 'Sham on blue cross blue shield, blue cross blue sheld more then doubled their rates, and offer the worst insurance coverage ever, their deductables are high, out of pocket high, why have insurance when you pay for everything yourself. their $600.00 a month policy is now $1,700.00 a month. sham sham', 'Isitusal, i took the best policy offered by my employer because i am a cancer survivor and testing is expensive. i also am being treated for depression and the meds i am prescribed are very expensive. however, the cost of just under $105.00 per week is to hard to keep up with along with my co-pays.', 'Ive learned i should pay a little more out of poc, im still seeking insurance that fits my budget.this company has good coverage but am paying a higher premium than i need because i dont have serious health conditions.', 'I always thought this was the best, but the monthly premiums are expensive and now that i am on senior care it seems to cover less than it once did.', 'Decent coverage but controlling, they switched my medication without going through my doctor due to it being cheaper for them. the new medication is not as effective and they declined my switch back to the old medication. currently appealing it.', 'Service sucks!!, i have been having some troubles with ordering prescriptions. the pharmacist wants to charge me 400 bucks after my deductible has been made. i have contacted bcbs several times and nothing has been done. they told me they would have it fixed yesterday, but no one called back. i left 3 messages yesterday with the case manager. can you help? any suggestions? case manager: bonita valles 401-459-5534 case number 4769-20mar17 so, as you can see, the case started on march 20th, but i actually called them a few days before that and they gave me an incomplete case number. i have psoriasis and it gets worse when i cant get my meds and if i get frustrated! well, i am frustrated. i am at the point where i need to get lawyers involved or go to channel 12 or 10.', 'Very costly', 'I detest this co but it is better than my last, clear your entire day if you need to get info from empire bc bs. it is very expensive insurance, you do not get to see the doctors you would like to see (hmo) and dealing with customer service is frustrating at best. you remain on hold forever and are transferred to three different people who put you on hold forever and it leaves such a bad taste in your mouth.', 'Dishonest and very stressful, last month, i noticed an increase in my premium so i called customer service. a seemingly nice lady told me it was for 2017. i asked if it was for 2017 why did i have to pay one for 2016. the customer service representative had told me that it was a mistake on their part to charge me early. and that next month in jan i would only need to pay my 2016 payment price in order to off-set the dec increase mistake, that after jan i would resume my new increased payments. to begin with, blue shield gave 0 warnings on an increase. i received no emails/mail! now, just got off the phone with another representative, a male this time. i saw that my payments this month were still for the new 2017, so i called to see why. the representative this time was unhelpful, he was confused most of the time, kept repeating the same information to me even after i told him several times that what he was telling me had nothing to do with my questions. it was stressful. the guy told me in the most round-about-way why i must pay my 2017 premium this month, and repeatedly kept avoiding my concerns. according to the new representative, the other IssuerName: SHA, LLC DBA FirstCare Health Plans
Reviews: ['I was entrusted by Geico insurance to this carrier. I had to file a claim with this company due to the severe weather that North Texas has been hit with over the last several months. I have been fighting with them for over a month in order for them to come and fix my home. They dont seem to be in any hurry to fix the issues (water is pouring into my house). It seems like the longer I wait the more damage that its going to cause to my house. I have conveyed that to them and the people set in place to help, dont give a rats ass about you. There attitude is so non caring that it makes you feel like you are begging. DO NOT GET INSURE BY THIS COMPANY. I have gone as far as contacting the CEO through linkedin to see if I get any sort of response from them. I am not holding my breath for one. I think that they think that if they ignore me long enough that i will go away. They messed with the wrong guy. I would rather spend the money on an attorney before I feel like I got taken advantage by them.']
['One word to describe the customer service and general insurance provided by Molina is RUN!!! If you are unfortunate enough to select them be aware of several things:']

['I had this insurance through my employer for 2 years and was laid off by my employer. My pain management provider graciously wrote me a 90-day script for pain medication to be filled on my last day of coverage, which SH promptly refused, stating it wasnt a maintenance medication. I havae been a chronic pain patient for 5 years and this is certainly maintenance for my chronic pain. When I called customer service, the rep could do nothing but parrot their policy. This is nothing but organized crime in my opinion, picking and choosing who is worthy of coverage. My God, when I think of how much money I flushed down the toilet in premiums, it makes me literally sick. Stay away from this insurer, theyre the epitome of corporate scumbaggery.']

['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if its something simple.', 'I hate bcbs, blue cross blue shield is the worst health insurance company i have ever had. although my back is a mess and i have spurs from the crumbling disks jabbing into my spinal cord.... which is causing pain and numbness down my left leg, bcbs denied the claim..... piss poor company......', 'Worse, lying, expensive insurance company, they are over priced, and the suck at communication. there deductible is super high that why they dont have to pay. when trying to file my claims i called and the agent told me to go online and get the claim form. i filed my claims twice and they sent me a rejection letter twice saying my information was incorrect, when calling again the agent told me they changed the paperwork and to file you have to take it to were you got your stuff done and have the doctor sign. when doing that (took me two days, since i work 6 days a week and had to travel all around town, and figuring when they work to get them signed), the agent gave me her personal email to send her the information which was the beginning of december. she told me to allow 30 days to file. i got in touch with her in january wondering the status, she said she had to file the docs again because the computer didnt scan them in correctly, and again wait 30 days, i called in the beginning of february, she went on to tell me that her computer crashed and lost all my info, (which it could have happen) thats why she didnt reach out to me, if i could resend her all the claims again, and wait another 30 days, in the beginning of march i got in touch with the agent and she told me that two of them went towards my deductible and the other one was paid. when asking for her to give me a statement so i could file thru my secondary insurance, she told me thats not necessary, and i told her if you were secondary for another customer wouldnt you want prove the other insurance didnt pay? she didnt get back to me for 10 minutes, so i called and talked to a different lady, and she sent it to me in 5 minutes. the original lady sent the paperwork the next day in the afternoon.when i tried to file the two claims that went towards my deductible, my other ['Terrible, aetna was one of several choices provided by my employer in this location. i have used them for several years now and i am very disappointed by their claims coverage and customer service. they repeatedly denied claims for services that should be covered (example: pt after surgery - that one should be a no-brainer). i have spent an unbelievable amount of time on the phone and in writing trying unsuccessfully to appeal denials. every time i call about a denied claim, the rep gives me a different story. twice i have filed all the required paperwork, gone through the appeals, been informed that the claim would be covered - only to have the decision reversed again down the line. their strategy seems to be to wear down the customer. in summary, aetna is the best advertisement for a single-payer system that i can think of. if you have any alternative - dont use them.', 'Utterly inconvenient-lame good for nothing coverag, so far....i have paid more than $5000 to doctors out of pocket. this company takes painfully long period to review the case once the patients file is sent for it. i have been calling them since around june to send my case for the review. its end of september now and i found out today that the case had still not been sent because a document was required and pending....which was faxed to them twice almost two months ago and it was confirmed over the phone that it has been received. anyway the agent put me on hold and then came back with the information that document was available with them in the system but the case for review was just not forwarded. i was obviously annoyed and asked why....the agent couldnt kept her cool and said she can only tell me what the system says and theres nothing she can do and that she cant speak for what the previous agents had been telling me. so... two more months if the report actually gets sent....and if it does and if the review is completed in next two months id have waited 5 months just for the review. and if i still after a couple of months find out report was sent for review id have to wait another couple of months because that just is how long it takes for the review process and verifications to complete...and i fear they are going to cover hardly anything the way they have been going about it so far...once the process does get completed....', 'Doesnt cover much, aside from the copay already being pretty high ($50) a visit, the insurance didnt cover much. ive had to have different doctors resubmit regular preventative care tests several times just to still end up with a large bill.', 'Appalling, unforgivably bad claims process, ive been insured twice with aetna international while working abroad (first in south africa, then in japan). while the website has evolved somewhat over time, the claims process remains absolutely abysmal. virtually every claim i filed was mishandled in some way and required follow-up, sometimes five or more times for a single claim. sometimes all records of a claim mysteriously disappeared, and aetna said they had no idea what had happened. in these cases, i forwarded them my confirmations of the submissions and they asked me to re-submit everything from scratch since they didnt know what had gone wrong. in other cases, ive had claims which were processed, approved, and supposedly paid out, but cant find any payment corresponding to the date on which they claimed to have paid. when ive asked for confirmation of where the money was sent, they didnt know and said theyd have to investigate. in other cases, payments did come through, but without a clear reference to identify which claims they corresponded to, and aetnas own people couldnt identify which payments corresponded to which claims. this isnt a trivial problem when youre working with foreign currencies whose exchange rates fluctuate. if i submit a claim in yen or euros, its not clear what the corresponding value will be in usd when the reimbursement reaches my us account. and since they sometimes pay out multiple claims in a single lump, this makes it even harder to identify without a detailed reference. ive also encountered numerous cases where they messed up the claim date, leading to further confusion. aetna international is based in the us, but forms submitted abroad typically have the date format reversed (dd/mm). one would think an insurer that caters specifically to expats would have this figured out, but no. if i visit the doctor on april 8, odds are high that theyll input it as august 4 instead.', 'Ffff, sold policy after speaking to rep. told all meds were covered. they were but it was cheaper to buy without etna insurance. was also told my doctor was in network, was not - got huge bill for out of network. etna is deceptive filed a complaint now told my policy will be cancelled. no integrity at all in regards to this money grubbing company. use at your own risk.', 'Antiquated and incompetent processes, #1 issue: ongoing since january 2016 is that aetna network management indicates to my provider his reimbursement is $80-84; yet aetna continues to process claims only paying provider $55. week after 2-3 months or more. #3 issue: customer service reps are so nice, making promises to assist, yet you get no where. customer service reps really can not do a thing for you. #4 issue: claims backlog for first three months of the year; eobs not mailed or uploaded on portal. eobs and claims are never processed real time, but run 30-45 days. eobs upload turn of the month and may be 1-2 months behind. i have had aetna for over 5 years through my work. like everyone i work with, i loved it...until i needed a doctor. my experience has led me to the thesis that they are unwilling to pay for claims if even the smallest technical problem is seen on the referral or a prescription is very expensive...in which case they require pre-authorization that is impossible to get approved in time in emergency situations (and backdating for reimbursements is a pasquinade to lure you into their premiums). for example, i recently needed a pre-authorization for a prescription that i paid for in an emergency. they take >48 hours to approve pre-auths, even in emergency situations. so, after about a week, i called member services. they told me that my pre-authorization had been approved! yay! however, they wanted me to call the specialty pharmacy to backdate the pre-auth. the rep sounded so genuinely surprised that i was approved that i called him out on it. though he was very nice, told me that he could not help me backdate the pre-auth, and that i should call the pre-auth number. when i did, i was told that there is no record i ever had a pre-auth and that i should call member services. so having come full circle, i called member services and reminded the representative that i had already called 3, and that i was told two days prior that my pre-auth was pending; one day prior i was told (surprisingly) that i was approved; and today i was told no such authorization was ever submitted by the doctor on my behalf. the subterfuge escalated, and i was told there was nobody available to help him find the missing record. he said he would call me back and he never did. i paid $1500 for my medication for the second time without being reimbursed. i wish this event was isolated, but over the past two years ive paid for 2 specialist visits and at least 3 medications out of pocket. the bottom line is: go with aetna only if you never plan on using your expensive health insurance policy!', 'Horrible save yourself, i have had a insurance plan on my son for 10 yrs. he was with another company that was bought out by aetna 2 years ago. on november 16 i called aetna because i heard they were pulling out of the area. when i called, they have confirmed they have the call, they said that his policy was not affected as it was not through the market place. when i called in january to pay his premium payment and was told his policy was cancelled. for the same reason they told me it wasnt affected. i tried to get a new policy quoted and got the run around being transferred all over then told someone would call me. meanwhile my son who takes medication monthly was without insurance and i was told we are sorry that you were given incorrect information and we do have that recorded but there is nothing we can do. so we suffer. luckily i was able to put him on my insurance at work although it is costing me double and affecting our finances since we had not planned on this type of burden. today 01.16.2017 i finally received a call from someone to quote the prices for a new policy, this is 2 weeks later. no thank you! save yourself and dont believe anything they tell you. when they mess up you will pay for it and they will do nothing to assist. they have no problem taking your money though.', 'Good news, aetna will no longer be listed as a choice on the healthcare marketplace. go to wikipedia and look up aetna. there ts a long list of abuses and complaints against them and fines they have paid throughout the years. enough said!', 'You cannot rely on them., aetna once provided me with a very inexpensive aca-grandfathered high-deductible plan. then one day aetna decided it was simply not going to renew my policy, thus leaving me stranded with no health IssuerName: Group Hospitalization and Medical Services Inc.
Reviews: ['I am a licensed life and health agent who sold myself an accident policy from IHC. I had the misfortune to break my arm and submit a claim. That was in June 2016. It is now the end of November and they have not paid on cent. They evidently do not plan on paying. I have provided original itemized bills, Explanations of Benefits from my primary health insurance company, an Attending physician statement, CMS Forms 1500, plus the providers are telling me that they have also sent in information. I know have correspondence that because they were never provided a diagnosis, that they are suspending activity on this file. I have spent countless hours on hold waiting to talk to someone. When you finally get a real person on the line, they are not helpful. I and have yet to do so. They ARE going to pay my claims even if I have to sue them. In the meantime, please save yourself the and do NOT do business with them!']

['I have held an American National life insurance policy for years. Their web site is like something from the very earliest days of the internet. Its horrible to navigate and paying your bill online is virtually impossible. It never recognizes my username and password and the policy number ON MY DOCUMENTATION from American National is NEVER recognized on their site. So I called several times to pay my premium and couldnt hold any longer on all calls (held for more than 30 minutes on each). Finally MAILED a check still in good time. Took them WEEKS to cash the check but finally they did. Then they sent me a letter telling me that my insurance was canceled pending reinstatement. I called again hoping to reinstate over the phone and held for 47 minutes. When I finally got through I was told reinstatement couldnt be done over the phone but once they received my forms I should (hopefully) be reinstated within a MONTH. Thanks for NOTHING. They should get their money back from their web designer except he/she probably got paid in 1994 for their work and no updates have been done since then.']

['Innovation Health in general is awful. The ONLY thing they are good at is figuring out how NOT to pay for services. They think using jazzy language and having bubbly graphics on their website makes them an effective insurance company, but they are wrong. Dont get sick out of state. They wont pay for any of it. Dont go to the ER out of state. They wont pay for it. Even if a hospital has Aetna, dont be fooled: if the hospital does not specifically say Innovation Health/Aetna, then they wont cover you. You have to live your entire life in Northern Virginia, or they wont cover you. (Or live in a bubble if you travel.) Dont even get sick past Mary Washington Hospital in Fburg. They wont cover you. Their deductibles are a little much for individuals. And when they negotiate a rate, they will only apply the negotiated rate to your deductible whether or not the hospital accepts it. (Say, for example, the hospital charges me 1,000 dollars for a procedure, and Innovation health assumes a negotiated rate will be 650, but you get a bill for 1,000, anyway. Innovation Health will only apply the 650 to your deductible, because, in their magical, pretend world, that is what they believe is fair. This is way, way too much bull for a plan. When enrollment is open again, I am getting out of this bs plan pronto.']

IssuerName: Kaiser Foundation Health Plan of the Mid-Atlantic States, Inc.
Reviews: ['After being on Kaiser from the age of six months to now at 58 and never having a problem, all that has changed. In the last few years the rates have gone up and up and service has gotten worse. Its all about the money. I have a chronic, painful condition- arthritis in my neck (diagnosed by a Kaiser Dr.) and TMJ. I have had an RX for a pain med and muscle relaxer for years, which was used only as needed and sparingly. I was sent a notice recently that they had assigned me a new Dr. after years of seeing the old one who never gave me a problem with refills. I recently sent in a refill request for my meds and the request was denied saying I had to come in for lab tests and an evaluation to determine if I actually had the condition and or if it still existed What??? NO! Im not stupid and know Arthritis and TMJ do not resolve. They are permanant conditions and lab tests etc. are NOT necessary for these conditions. They only want me to come in and pay the MUCH higher than before co-pays to run tests that are not necessary and are worthless as far as my conditions. They kept me going through tons of red tape and hearings I didnt request only to keep denying me my meds. NO more Kaiser for us. We are leaving and going to a new health plan. Kaiser is no longer the good company it once was. Now its corporate greed.']

['Optima was the only one offerd by my employer after the ACA TAX AKA OBOMA Care. We had awesome insurance only to be told that now Optima was all they could find that was affordable for the company and employees. The old saying You get what you pay for. Doesnt even apply. I pay a ton and get nothing. I had two outpatient surgeries and two ER visits two years ago. I have never filed a big claim like these except once in the 1990s. Long and short of it I ended up with the majority of the bills but have been told I have the best policy they offer. I ended up with nothing from the bills going to my deductible and ended up paying above and beyond the deductible. Very disappointed want Blue Cross Blue Shield back.']

IssuerName: Compcare Health Serv Ins Co(Anthem BCBS)
Reviews: ['AVOID THEM. LIKE THE PLAGUE. If you have plague, youll still want to avoid']

['Please be aware that Group Health plans in Washington State (the lower coverage plans specifically) provide less coverage than Medicare alone (youre paying premiums (in addition to Medicare) to receive less coverage than youd have without the added coverage). Claims for medically necessary procedures and after care that would be covered by Medicare are denied by Group Health. Treatments and services covered are changed throughout the year. For example - they now (as of last month and immediately effective) consider full hip replacement surgery to be an ELECTIVE surgery and will not pay for ANY rehab. Even though Dr. says its absolutely medically necessary, critical to patients health and safety. Please check to see what may not be covered through your current plan with Group Health and check with your health care providers about this Insurance Group. Consider changing during open season while you have the opportunity to one that at least covers what Medicare alone would cover.']

['I am under my step mothers health insurance. I will be turning 26 in August so I have to have my own coverage by September 1, 2002. If I dont have coverage I will lose my right to have health insurance.']

['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']

['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']
['One word to describe the customer service and general insurance provided by Molina is RUN!!! If you are unfortunate enough to select them be aware of several things:']
['To May It Concern:']

IssuerName: Security Health Plan of Wisconsin, Inc.
Reviews: ['If youre looking into purchasing health insurance through Security Health Care, DONT! They really need to get their act together before they can be considered real insurance. For the past 18 months I have been calling to update my billing address and each attempt was pointless. Now I am stuck paying $349 more a month to pay for their mistakes. Customer Service only forwards you to the next person just for them to repeat the same thing, sorry, we cant help you with that. I called three times this month to update my billing address and every time they ask me to verify my address, its still incorrect! Pathetic.. Being billed hundreds of dollars for their mistakes is not acceptable.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Wyoming
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number ['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']

['After being on Kaiser from the age of six months to now at 58 and never having a problem, all that has changed. In the last few years the rates have gone up and up and service has gotten worse. Its all about the money. I have a chronic, painful condition- arthritis in my neck (diagnosed by a Kaiser Dr.) and TMJ. I have had an RX for a pain med and muscle relaxer for years, which was used only as needed and sparingly. I was sent a notice recently that they had assigned me a new Dr. after years of seeing the old one who never gave me a problem with refills. I recently sent in a refill request for my meds and the request was denied saying I had to come in for lab tests and an evaluation to determine if I actually had the condition and or if it still existed What??? NO! Im not stupid and know Arthritis and TMJ do not resolve. They are permanant conditions and lab tests etc. are NOT necessary for these conditions. They only want me to come in and pay the MUCH higher than before co-pays to run tests that are not necessary and are worthless as far as my conditions. They kept me going through tons of red tape and hearings I didnt request only to keep denying me my meds. NO more Kaiser for us. We are leaving and going to a new health plan. Kaiser is no longer the good company it once was. Now its corporate greed.']
