['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']

['Horrible health insurance. expensive. bad coverage, i have united health care through my company. i hate it. it is so expensive out of my pocket, and i know my company pays a lot more than i do. the coverage is not great. i have a family of 3. the claims for my son and my husband routinely get denied. they seem to think that they know better what to provide you than your doctor does (the one that actually met with you, examined you and determined the right treatment). i have had to make several appeals for denials of service over the last year and a half. it is crazy all the work you have to go through to have them pay claims. plus the recent two appeals got denied again. so more money out of my pocket! the larger items, are only covered with 50-60 % so you have to pay a bunch there too. dont even get me started on the prescription coverage (its even worse!). i have tried to look at new insurance, but because my company offers health insurance, i was told that when i went to the marketplace, i would not qualify for any credits. really tight spot to be in. i wish i could just fire them. beware of united healthcare. not a good insurance company to deal with.', 'Companie have been cheaper to be un-insured and use the billing structure then to submit to uhc> i paid 54 dolars more than an un-insured person would have paid. i am not sure what my premiums are paying for. i have felt in years. last week i was told by my treatment program director that united healthcare has only approved 19 sessions of a 30 session program and they felt that this program was just like an inpatient program and they wouldnt approve more than 19 sessions. my program director said that this is common with united healthcare and they often deny full coverage for substance abuse recovery programs. i had to already pay $640.00 out of my own pocket for this program to meet my out of pocket maximum and i dont know how im going to be able to pay for the 11 remaining sessions. this is very frustrating i have always felt that i had the best health insurance around that cared about its customers. but in this instance they clearly do not. they pay to get my started and well into my ['When I was healthy, Medica was great. It covered the few prescriptions I had and my annual exams. Then, I had back surgery. Suddenly, they stopped knowing how to do paperwork. I heard various and sundry excuses for nine months following my surgery as to why they had not yet paid Mayo Clinic what they were supposed to pay them. First, they were really backed up. Then, my claim was incorrectly auto-adjudicated. The most recent one Ive heard is that they arent paying their own bills! They have (had?) a contract with Mayo, and since they havent been paying what theyre supposed to, Mayo is balanced billing me. Over the past nine months, I have spoken to twelve different Medica employees, a few of them on more than one occasion. Each of them has been very cordial but apparently very limited in their ability to help their clients, as I am STILL dealing with this problem nine months later. I cant help but wonder if they are hoping Ill be sent to collections by the clinic so that it wont be their problem anymore. I gave them the benefit of the doubt for several months; I should not have to give benefits to my insurance company. Last I heard, it was supposed to be the other way around.']

['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

IssuerName: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas, Inc.
Reviews: ['Denied coverage of needed surgery , currently blue cross blue shield is denying my wife coverage of a necessary surgery that could keep her out of a wheelchair in the future. their initial reasoning has the surgery not necessary. the surgeon and her personal doctor seemed to differ with blue cross blue shields initial assessment. we have requested her records and been told that it takes 30 days to get them to us. her surgeon has also made appeals. but they are still wont cover it. now they are stating that she hasnt gone through physical therapy or taking cortisone shots. but she has gone through physical therapy and it was stopped because it only perpetuated the problem she is also allergic to prednisone which has some of the same chemical compound of cortisone. yet they still deny coverage. i recommend finding a company that has a proven history of covering necessary surgeries. or you could be left out in the cold like we are now.', 'Worst health insurance ever, bcbs of nm bought lovelace with whom i was insured and i was assured the coverage would be the same. this company attempted to force me to have surgery done by an incompetent doctor instead of allowing me to go out of network to a qualified surgeon as my urologist/oncologist recommended to them in writing. i changed to united health care and have been happy. the people that work in their claims office are incompetent. you get a different person every time you contact them and you get a different answer as to why your claim has not been paid. this is not the old bcbs from a few years ago. these people are some of the worst in the health care industry.', 'Poor customer service/long waits, ive been hung up on. yelled at. transferred countless times across their departments. i have to get my id number every single time i talk to someone, and i usually have to talk between 5 different employees just to get a simple answer. im stuck with bcbs, but damn they need to improve how they handle and treat customers that call in.', 'The worst insurance company, the coverage is very expensive and dont cover anything. they will always argue about coverage and will try to get away with it. i feel not safe being with this company.', 'Terrible wont cover anything, why waste your money i have a premium plan and anything i get prescribed gets denied. they are legal thief and liars i pay 1200 a month for nothing go elsewhere terrible !!!', 'Costing to much monthly, can not afford this blue cross and blue shield any longer. $23,000.00 yearly is to costly for us.', 'Worse customer service than the cable company, i decided to switch my policy this year with bcbs, because the policy i previously had with bcbs increased by $90 per month and the coverage was not as good. i did it through the exchange, never received a bill, never received insurance cards, it takes over an hour to get a hold of anyone. generally they cannot find my info. next year i will be switching to another company this is outrageous!!!!', 'Never again, ive had bcbs for years. never had a problem until coming to south carolina. they denied a claim for 6 months without reason, just sent a denial, and finally when pressed - claimed i wasnt a covered individual. strange considering they had premiums from my paycheck for 9 months...finally when called on it, claimed that the new reason was the lack of an &, i.e. the claim was submitted to bcbs, not bc&bs. well two of those initials are correct. for inauguration day, they announce that effective 1/1, they would no longer cover certain medications i was on. and go figure, those medications were working. had they told me during open enrollment - i would have investigated another option - now i cannot for 12 months. lets not even go into the fact that they notify me that they stopped covering items the day the coverage year started not in advance - but 3 weeks after the fact, and 7 weeks after my coverage decisions were final for the next year. instead, they require me to take an alternative, which caused an adverse reaction that nearly put me in the hospital. so, off that medicine - on to another one. tell my doctor the new medicine is covered - and 12 hours later at the pharmacy, it is denied. instead they suggested 1) i should go back on the prior medicine...the adverse reaction will eventually go away. 2) i should take another drug - which i am already on. i point this out, and they suggest i take more. i point out i am at the fda maximum dose, and they suggest, i should still take more - these maximums arent really limits. so, right now they are refusing to cover a different medicine until i go back on the other medicine. after all, it is my fault i am sick. my doctor and i have filed an appeal - bcbs says 3-6 months before a decision. i cant help but feel like they are hoping i will just die before they have to provide coverage.', 'Self plus one - same cost as family, i switched from family option to self plus one and the cost is 12 dollars less a month! unbelievable! and they advertise this as something new! i have been paying 460dollars plus my company matches the same amount - so almost 1000 dollars for no 12 years! premiums too high plus deductible. cannot wait to change the provider in the open season.', 'Horrible service, 1. they wont change your address even if you put it in writing and mail it. 2. they terminated my insurance after a member service representative informed me i was renewed. 3. i never got a call from a supervisor as i told i was going to . it is to painful to go on. on just plain insensitive ,horrible and out of integrity.', 'Forced into hmo, no providers, only individual policy offered in 2016 was an hmo, last year i had a ppo with bcbs. none of my specialists take hmos. its a crime to have to pay outrageous insurance premiums $664.00 a month, for an individual plan, then have to pay again out of pocket to see a specialist. i will never use bcbs again.', 'Bcbs, i was a member of trs active as a teacher. since i took early retirement, i do not qualify for their continued insurance even though i worked 20 years. their policies are way too expensive for me now.', 'Horrible coverage/service, the website is horribly complicated. it is impossible to find out what my plan covers or dose not unless you have the medical codes for everything and you call in. the customer service is slow and i have been told completely different things by different representatives. every time you call customer service be prepared to spend 40-60+ minutes on the phone. even if ['Signed up for MegaLife + NASE policy when I became self-employed. Rarely used the policy even for preventative services initially but still paid the separate $200-$300 monthly premium to ML and $40 monthly fee to NASE. When I cancelled my policy, was told that the ~$1000 for claims and ~$850 in prescription fees exceeded the amount that was accumulated in the so-called Return of Premium feature and so was not eligible for any refunds of premium. So of the $18,000 that I paid to Mega alone, I send in $1000 of claims and $850 of prescriptions and Im not eligible for a premium return? I also have the receipts for the other thousands of dollars in claim fees and lab fees and other services that they didnt pay for so this plan actually cost me closer to $30,000. It would have been a better deal for me to pay completely out of pocket for all of my medical expenses rather than give them $16,000 for services not rendered. THIS IS NOT A GOOD COMPANY. THEY DO NOT HAVE A GOOD PRODUCT. And NASEs representation of them means that NASE is also a scam. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS before it costs you more than it did me.']

['Horrible health insurance. expensive. bad coverage, i have united health care through my company. i hate it. it is so expensive out of my pocket, and i know my company pays a lot more than i do. the coverage is not great. i have a family of 3. the claims for my son and my husband routinely get denied. they seem to think that they know better what to provide you than your doctor does (the one that actually met with you, examined you and determined the right treatment). i have had to make several appeals for denials of service over the last year and a half. it is crazy all the work you have to go through to have them pay claims. plus the recent two appeals got denied again. so more money out of my pocket! the larger items, are only covered with 50-60 % so you have to pay a bunch there too. dont even get me started on the prescription coverage (its even worse!). i have tried to look at new insurance, but because my company offers health insurance, i was told that when i went to the marketplace, i would not qualify for any credits. really tight spot to be in. i wish i could just fire them. beware of united healthcare. not a good insurance company to deal with.', 'Companie weeks to find out how i am doing, changes in meds, any new health problems. the nurse is very helpful and informative. my only problem is the high cost, but i guess its goes back to the saying you get what you pay for.', 'Worst insurance company ive ever had to deal with, september 2017 this policy was chosen by my husbands employer and is the worst company ive ever had to work with. we have been with them for a little over two years. they have paid one claim to each of two doctors i have seen during this entire time. ive called, the doctors billing departments have called and they refuse to help. every claim has been denied and they refuse to pay and none of can ever speak to anyone that can/ will help us understand what they need or why theyre of paying. they keep saying they need full medical records and they have been sent repeatedly and denied repeatedly. yesterday i received a call from my doctor office and they are now refusing further medical care. i have a chronic health condition for which i am required to see the doctor once a month and they cannot by law treat or prescribe my medication without seeing me. at this point i am unsure what i am going to do. this may possibly be a situation that ends my life. my doctor is going to turn it over to their attorney but i could be dead before they get a resolution. if you have ability to choose your insurance provider please make certain you choose another company', 'Overall pretty good in all ares, if my company was not closing i would stay with the health plan.', 'United healthcare covered my docotors appointments, unitedcare did cover all my doctors appointments. my bloodwork & my port being flushed. it also covered my petscan that i needed to have.', '13, would like something cheaper than 170.00 a month', 'Thet have given excellent coverage, united healthcare has always been there for me giving me excellent coverage in times that i needed it. their deductbles are very reasonable and their coverage is excellent. this is why i would to find out what it cost me per month.', 'Overal the company was satisfactory, the policy was satisfactory but the company decided that it was no longer to offer insurance after the end of this year', 'Never again, they hung up on me', 'Very good, they are very fair in covering their claims', 'Satisfied with present insurance company, contract with school board final as of july. checking to see what personal health insurance will cost in the future.', 'Lost coverage through employer, i lost coverage through my employer and am now in disability.', 'Not eligible for medicaid, not eligible for medicaid', 'Im turning 26 need own insurance, i was under my moms policy . now i am turning 26 yrs old . have to get my own poilcy', 'Excellent, its a great plan. covered all mr rxs specialist dental n optical.able to cover all my medical conditions. and all specialist i needed for my diabetes', 'Michigan medicaid, i have uhc through michigans medicaid program. i now live in florida and have medical issues that need to be address soon. i will be filling for ssd once i am fully settled in florida.', 'Cost very high, i am looking for less expensive insurance because i dont have a job yet.', 'Good company, i have medicare. so far of all the dr appointments i have had the only payments were made by medicare. i pay a high i lost that job, so i wont be able to afford the kind of great policy that i had through that job.', 'My mom is getting ready to retire, my mom has carried me on united health care for 18 years. she IssuerName: Cigna Health and Life Insurance Company
Reviews: ['Broke promises, wish i could give them 0 stars. they have lied and stalled and wasted so much of my time. i was told i would be refunded through submitted a medical claim form. i was even told i would receive payment in 2 weeks! that was 6 months ago!', 'Great service , i really liked cigna, the only reason i left is because they couldnt cover me anymore due to my move out of state. i guess they just didnt have anyone out here. they are kind of expensive but what insurance isnt anymore? it was pretty much the best price i could find. but not bad guest service.', 'Annual price increase, i have had insurance for the past 40+ years, previously with my employer, but now im paying over $3,000 a quarter of $216,000 converage. the price is now rediculous, but at 71 years old how can i change???????', 'Cigna, i have been very happy with cigna, they have good coverage and are easy to get a hold of when i have questions. good dental coverage as well.', 'I would rather deal with the cable company, terrible customer service, glacial claims processing, a willingness to find any reason to deny, impossible to communicate with. in 30+ years of work, i have never dealt with a worse insurance provider. absolutely horrible.', 'False representation of benefits, needed an elective ultrasound for rule out of cancerous tumor. called cigna to ensure that my current insurance plan covers the procedure. cigna representative provided information that if i completed my procedure at the diagnostic center on the list provided and emailed to my attention, the procedure is covered 100% regardless of my deductible and all i am responsible only for the office copayment. then a month later after the procedure, i received a cigna statement stating that the ultrasound procedure is not covered 100% because i have not met the plan deductible. this is false representation of benefits by cigna. please beware of this insurance company. we just recently switch to cigna, and sadly to say that the poor reviews for this insurance company is true. cigna falsely represent their benefits to their customers especially when there is a non-routine procedure to be completed. do not recommend my experience with cigna has been a great one.', 'High premiums, cigna was our provider for 22 years. premiums went up outrageously the past two years.', 'Very helpful customer service, they had no problem spending time with you on the phone.teir rates were competitive for medicare supplement needs.', 'Cigna is employer picked plan, cigna is an employer selected plan for group health care plan benefit for its employees.', 'This was the cheapest option for group coverage offered by my company and that is why i went with connecticut general health insurance.', 'Good company, i like the effectiveness and customer service. it is the only insurance my company offered and it has served my family well... but now that we have an option to receive cheaper more cost efficient insurance for our family we are looking into our options.', 'My health, i loved this insurance it was the only one i had. i got it through work. but now with the presidents insurance plan i am loosing the one i like. it only cost me $100-$125 a month and was taken out of my check. now his plan is going to cost me over $300 a month. now i have to look for the affordable health care he promised.', 'Company provided coverage, its the best coverage they have had yet and wish they could pay a little extra to make it easier on me with my regular bills', 'Great, good phone service and coverage is decent', 'Not sure just what you want. is it cigna?', 'Employer based coverage, employer based coverage. switched jobs. need new insurance', 'Provided through work, i want to purchase insurance for my grankids', 'This insurance was provided by my employer', 'Good, insurance offered through husbands work. no complaints, but now looking at alternatives for myself alone. customer service has always been great. good solid company.', 'I am presently covered under my fathers insurance. i will be turning 26 years old and will no longer be covered', 'Coverage terminating 11/30/2016, after i was laid off in early 2015 the package they gave me had insurance coverage up t0 11/302016', 'My cobra ends dec 31, 20016, i am 64 and searching for individual health insurance that is affordable as i am currently unemployed.', 'B v,, hvfhgc', 'Was the company plan, good coverage company plan', 'Employer coverage, looking at options beyond just through employer', 'On cobra for 18 months after let go at my job of 23plus years due to disability. have had cigna for all the time i have been employed they do not cover nh otherwise i would like to stay with them.', 'Company provided through mother', 'Would love to keep this company, retiring, need coverage i can afford, not sure but i may be keeping cigna', 'Good hdhp plan at a reasonable cost, i am really pleased with cigna and would an individual plan that is similar. the provider network coverage is great.', 'Good, over all was a good deal with a very easy application. customer service was very friendly and i look forward to working with them again.', 'Good, good insurance co. i like it', 'Good, on cobra , expensive but good', 'Cigna health, i was insured with cigna via my company. in january i was laid off and the cost for cigna is extremely high.', 'Annual mammograms, will not cover annual mammograms we have paid for al mammograms cost for 3 years..they will not help on the phone and never can understand english', 'Coverage was good, most doctor offices accepted the plan.', 'Most of the time they are good to work with., for the most part we have been happy with cigna. one instance, a not helpful rep, left us fighting to have a large bill covered. other than that they have been ok!', 'Great insurance company, cigna is an amazing insurance company. they cover almost everything. their customer service department is the best and never any long wait time.', 'Bad office experiance, referrals are given to patients we go to thhe doctor only to find out later that the doctor or facility they send you to is not coverd and we end up with a very big bill no one knows anything ,front office staff is not very friendy,,when your sick they refuse to see you and always want you to go to urgent care that cost alot.', 'On cobra and its done july 2015, i was part of lay off and cigna was offerd as cobra', 'My mothers insurance--it was fine., i was on cigna through my mother for a few years while i was in school. it covered most of what i needed done. but im 26 this year so im off it and i need my own in case i get sick.', 'Accepted widely, cigna is accepted widely. limits are reasonable but copays are high.', 'Ok with cigna, currently on cobra', 'Lost job - paying cobra prices, i have cigna cobra - very expensive and lost job so looking for insurance', 'Was on my parents insurance which ends on 01/31/2015', 'Cigna was the insurance company that the company i work for was contracted with, as we are a self insured company, they also had something to do with greatwestern.', 'Cigna, this is the insurance they give you', 'Cigna is good insurance company, cigna is offered by my employeer over thel ast 10 plus years i ahve been very satisfied. overall i would recommend cigna!', 'Excellent coverage, i thought that cigna provided excellent coverage, but they are becoming to expensive for me.', 'Got insurance with my employer.very satisfied and looking for more affordable health insurance.', 'Coverage was through my significant others employer. great service and coverage, but employer is no loner offering coverage with cigna.', 'Thet were ok, lost the coverage due to my spouse retired. they were ok. difficulties to get approvals for necessary tests. their customer service and nursing advise services are great.', 'Cigna offered by my former employer. never had issues with claims, bills were paid timely and group rate was very reasonable', 'I have recently retired from my job which used cigna insurance for our group. i am not yet eligible for medicare as i am only 63 and need coverage until that time.', 'Very good insurance, it is very good health insursurance,i being with this company for 20 years,but i recently lost another insurance that have with my job,because i became part time worker,so that is why i like to have another insurance.thank you elsa hernandez', 'Excellent, thanks a lot for the qoutes', 'Lost employer coverage', 'No review my husband devorice me, when i was on the insurance it was good i am going to not have because my exhusband will be taking me off of his insurance. thank you for your help.', 'Cobra, i have cigna thru former employer via cobra. effective 6/1 and claims so far have gone well and for most part been paid. cost is too high!', 'Looking for cheaper insurance', 'Not enough insurance per obama care, this insurance has worked for me for the past 3 years...now oboma says its not enough', 'Loosing coverage at end of month, i am in desperate need of insurance. i have a permanent colostomy due to colo-rectal cancer. i need insurance to cover my colostomy supplies. i currently am covered by cobra this is was through cigna.', 'Review, not covering as much as i would like', 'None, none', 'Great plan if not self-employed, cigna is an awesome health insurance company with great customer service but is far too expensive for an individual', 'Good and affordable', 'Company provided,', 'Company provided the insurance,', 'Settled claims in a timely manner,', 'Expensive,', 'Lost job need to get inc.,', 'I had a great experience!!!!,', 'Losing because of less hours,', 'Husbands employer,', 'Gps review ,', 'Insured under parent,']

['Terrible, aetna was one of several choices provided by my employer in this location. i have used them for several years now and i am very disappointed by their claims coverage and customer service. they repeatedly denied claims for services that should be covered (example: pt after surgery - that one should be a no-brainer). i have spent an unbelievable amount of time on the phone and in writing trying unsuccessfully to appeal denials. every time i call about a denied claim, the rep gives me a different story. twice i have filed all the required paperwork, gone through the appeals, been informed that the claim would be covered - only to have the decision reversed again down the line. their strategy seems to be to wear down the customer. in summary, aetna is the best advertisement for a single-payer system that i can think of. if you have any alternative - dont use them.', 'Utterly inconvenient-lame good for nothing coverag, so far....i have paid more than $5000 to doctors out of pocket. this company takes painfully long period to review the case once the patients file is sent for it. i have been calling them since around june to send my case for the review. its end of september now and i found out today that the case had still not been sent because a document was required and pending....which was faxed to them twice almost two months ago and it was confirmed over the phone that it has been received. anyway the agent put me on hold and then came back with the information that document was available with them in the system but the case for review was just not forwarded. i was obviously annoyed and asked why....the agent couldnt kept her cool and said she can only tell me what the system says and theres nothing she can do and that she cant speak for what the previous agents had been telling me. so... two more months if the report actually gets sent....and if it does and if the review is completed in next two months id have waited 5 months just for the review. and if i still after a couple of months find out report was sent for review id have to wait another couple of months because that just is how long it takes for the review process and verifications to complete...and i fear they are going to cover hardly anything the way they have been going about it so far...once the process does get completed....', 'Doesnt cover much, aside from the copay already being pretty high ($50) a visit, the insurance didnt cover much. ive had to have different doctors resubmit regular preventative care tests several times just to still end up with a large bill.', 'Appalling, unforgivably bad claims process, ive been insured twice with aetna international while working abroad (first in south africa, then in japan). while the website has evolved somewhat over time, the claims process remains absolutely abysmal. virtually every claim i filed was mishandled in some way and required follow-up, sometimes five or more times for a single claim. sometimes all records of a claim mysteriously disappeared, and aetna said they had no idea what had happened. in these cases, i forwarded them my confirmations of the submissions and they asked me to re-submit everything from scratch since they didnt know what had gone wrong. in other cases, ive had claims which were processed, approved, and supposedly paid out, but cant find any payment corresponding to the date on which they claimed to have paid. when ive asked for confirmation of where the money was sent, they didnt know and said theyd have to investigate. in other cases, payments did come through, but without a clear reference to identify which claims they corresponded to, and aetnas own people couldnt identify which payments corresponded to which claims. this isnt a trivial problem when youre working with foreign currencies whose exchange rates fluctuate. if i submit a claim in yen or euros, its not clear what the corresponding value will be in usd when the reimbursement reaches my us account. and since they sometimes pay out multiple claims in a single lump, this makes it even harder to identify without a detailed reference. ive also encountered numerous cases where they messed up the claim date, leading to further confusion. aetna international is based in the us, but forms submitted abroad typically have the date format reversed (dd/mm). one would think an insurer that caters specifically to expats would have this figured out, but no. if i visit the doctor on april 8, odds are high that theyll input it as august 4 instead.', 'Ffff, sold policy after speaking to rep. told all meds were covered. they were but it was cheaper to buy without etna insurance. was also told my doctor was in network, was not - got huge bill for out of network. etna is deceptive filed a complaint now told my policy will be cancelled. no integrity at all in regards to this money grubbing company. use at your own risk.', 'Antiquated and incompetent processes, #1 issue: ongoing since january 2016 is that aetna network management indicates to my provider his reimbursement is $80-84; yet aetna continues to process claims only paying provider $55. week after week, month after month, aetna has not resolved this issue. #2 issue: really takes a long time to dispute claims, have claims reviewed, re-processed; something that should only take a few days takes 2-3 months or more. #3 issue: customer service reps are so nice, making promises to assist, yet you get no where. customer service reps really can not do a thing for you. #4 issue: claims backlog for first three months of the year; eobs not mailed or uploaded on portal. eobs and claims are never processed real time, but run 30-45 days. eobs upload turn of the month and may be 1-2 months behind. corrected eobs do not ever show up on the portal, only the first claim entry, first eob, is posted, not any revised ones. #5 the right hand does not know what the left hand is doing. for real! this company is really mismanaged.', 'They are the worst insurance company, i have to switch to aetna because of work. i have had a heart condition for 13 years. $ years ago my cardiologist prescribed a new medication because the one i was taking wasnt working. in this time period 3 insurance companies paid for it but aetna denied it asked for documentation from my doctor which he sent, they again denied it saying we need 1 month proof of failure. i guess they want proof that i will dead then okay. same thing for another medication that because of my resent test results my doctor prescribed again they denied it. for these 2 medications my doctor sent them 100 pages of documentation. they charge me over $750 monthly and then this. if this isnt a scam then what is?', 'Ellen was very personable and seemed to really care about my moms situation.he showed me all our options and then let us decide for ourselves which one we thought was best she didnt try to sway us at all', 'Aetna = pos insurance, aetna is just plain a pos insurance company, one of my medications that use to be $25 with humana is now $112 with aetna!!!! i called and asked wtf? they just said it was a speciality med, i asked why could humana charge $25 and aetna could not, they basically told me they were a little more expensive, a little more??? from $25 to $110 !!! my wife has been on this medication for her face, again no problems with humana, but with aetna, they refused to fill her prescription, i have been getting injections in my knee so i can function at work and lead a normal life, with humana, no problem, with aetna, they refused, aetna is the worst insurance on the planet, they are a complete pos, you pay premiums for what??? oh but when the rep is here at work, she glorifies as if aetna
